Messenger | Email | Phone: (833) MY-MILES  | San Diego Office 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 

 
FAQPerformance Support Components Payments and Shipping Misc PerformanceMy Miles Arrived. What now?  What’s the difference between the Dual and Single?The Single has one powerful hub motor while the Dual has two.  The Single will hit speeds of 18-20 mph, but won’t accelerate or brake as fast as the Dual. The Single comes with a basic remote with fast/slow, forward, brake and reverse functions. There is no display.The Dual comes with a premium remote with information display and safety light on top of the basic functions.  Why do you use hub motors and not clumsy belt motors?The first electric skateboards were developed with elbow grease and off the shelf components. They were clever devices made of hobby motors bolted to skateboard wheels. We salute the pioneers that brought electric skateboarding to life!Belt motors are typically geared down so they can achieve more torque than hub motors. The torque helps in acceleration, hill climbing and off road riding. There is a trade off however , as there are more moving parts, more friction, a loud whine and more things to break. That means range and top speed can suffer with belt motors. If you’ve ever tried to ride a board with belt motors, you can feel what a drag all those moving parts and friction can be. On or off, that friction is what robs you of speed and range.  Now that more riders like you have embraced electric skating, technology has evolved and it's now possible to put the motor directly inside the wheel. This means that you can ride with less moving parts, less friction, less weight and more fun! It's why you can get incredible range on a Miles board and still cruise at incredible speeds.Belt motors may be cheaper to manufacture, but for a sleek street board, they’re not for us. We wanted a fast, smooth, lightweight sexy ride that lasts for miles and miles. Hub motors were the clear choice! What range can you get?From our testing data (and we push the boards hard!), we get the following range:Single: 7-12 MilesDual: 10-18 MilesWith the airline friendly battery, you can expect about 6-14 miles from either board. Your mileage will vary based on weight, terrain and speed. Why is the Range longer than other boards?Both Single and Dual come with high capacity lithium batteries. The Single has a 108WH battery while the Dual has a 144WH battery.WH = Watt Hours, is a measurement of the total energy in a batteryThis is more capacity than popular boards like the Boosted 2 (99WH), Boosted Mini S (99WH), and Inboard (97WH).  Not only does it have more battery capacity, but with less moving parts (NO BELTS = less friction = more efficient), Miles boards can achieve incredible range.Beware: Many electric skateboard brands (especially the budget ones) don’t even publish their battery capacity. Are they afraid you’ll find out the truth? Can I get another high capacity battery?Yes, you can get it here. Choose the capacity you want. Note that the Single 3AH, Dual 4AH, and Airline Friendly 2.75AH battery can be interchanged and used in either board. Can you change the battery?Yes, you can swap the battery out in about 5 minutes. Just remove the deck lid, turn the battery off, unplug it and insert your new battery. This feature is great for those that want a looong ride! How long does it take to charge?Typically 1-2 hours, slightly longer if completely dead.  I’m heavy, can I ride it?If you weigh less than 270 lbs, that’s a big YES. Though we often ride 2 up for a combined weight of ~350lbs, we can’t recommend it. Performance will decline with increased weight and the boards are not officially tested past 270lbs.  I’m tall, can I ride it?Yes, there’s no height limit and the board is very stable for all folks short and tall. Check out this review from Brett, a 6’4” Miles Rider in Folsom. Can you ride it with no battery or no remote?Yes! The hub motors are precision engineered for the least drag possible. Boards with belt motors (and orange wheels :P ), are a drag to push with no power. Miles is a breeze to push and cruises almost as fast as a traditional push longboard. Is this practical to use for commuting daily to work (5 miles) and shopping, etc?Yes! 5 miles is a great distance to shred on your Miles. With the Dual you'll probably make it there and back in one charge too. You’ll have the most fun if your roads are smooth and it will sure beat uber, traffic, busses etc. Can I ride it underwater?The board is water resistant, not waterproof. That means you can ride through light rain and decent sized puddles but you can’t go swimming with it.The motors are completely waterproof and can run completely underwater. The electronics and battery in the deck are not waterproof, so it’s not a good idea to submerge the whole board or ride in heavy/torrential rains. The warranty does not cover water damage. Can I ride it in the Grass? YES. You can cruise over cut grass from a dead stop but may want to get a rolling start if it's on the longer side. Grass takes more energy to roll over than asphalt, so it will slow any board down and use more battery than it would on hard surfaces.Miles is designed for asphalt, concrete, and other hard surfaces and that's where it really shines. Don't let that stop you from getting creative though. Take the board to the golf course and shred it up if you fancy!! Can I ride it Off-Road? It's not the smoothest ride we've ever had, but it definitely powers through to get you from point A to B!! While it is meant to shred the streets, the board can handle grass & gravel surfaces. The Powerful Hub Motors and Extremely Durable Wheels combine to allow you to continue shredding through those rough terrains!! Can I ride it in the Sand? NO! Sand is too fluffy to get through on even the MIles Dual. The board just sinks in and sprays sand everywhere. You'd need big off-road tires to get over sand, and even then, only hard-packed wet sand will work. Miles is not an off-road board, but if you want to get creative you can always fly over hard dirt trails or grass!! Can it do powerslides?Yup! Can you? How much weight can it tow?We're gonna need more people next time!How does it handle cold weather? While this was just a few minutes at an extremely cold temperature, the board did better than us. It's tough to imagine you'll be able to ride in any weather cold enough to shut the board off!As with all batteries, the lower the temperature, the lower the discharge rate and capacity of the battery. For example, at 10 below freezing, the battery can discharge at about 40% of its normal capacity. The board will still work at this temperature however, your max power, speed, and range will decrease... The good news is the motors and battery will heat up slightly during use to improve power and range.There is definitely a temperature at which the battery won't be able to power on the board. Luckily, we've never been cold enough to experience this, but according to data from our battery supplier, we believe it's around -25 degrees Fahrenheit. At that temperature, we recommend finding a loved one and cuddling up by the fire before you go out and shred ice!Storing the board indoors at room temperature before going out into extreme cold will greatly increase the performance under cold temperatures as the internals will be closer to ideal operating temperature.What colors do Miles come in?Black and pink baby! The Miles Board comes with a swappable deck lid so you can purchase extras and swap them to fit your mood in minutes Keep an eye out because we’ll be adding more in the future!  How many watts are the Motors?We don't disclose the motor wattage because it's become industry standard to lie about motor power. You deserve better than that.Many companies claim to have 2000W, 3000W motors when they only have 100WH batteries... Let's calculate that out: 100WH/3000W = .05 hours of run time. If their claims were true you could only use the board for 2 minutes!You're welcome to put the board up against top brands and compare performance, you won't be disappointed! SupportIs there a warranty?Yes, we’ve got your back with a 6 month warranty that covers the entire board from defect or malfunction under normal use. If anything on the board should stop working, just hit us up (call 833-MYMILES) and we’ll get you rolling again in no time! The warranty does not cover any damage from misuse (including water damage), tampering or unauthorized alterations/repairs.  What if it’s past the warranty or I broke it myself?No stress, we still have your back with excellent support (from real humans in the US) and will help you purchase the correct replacement component(s) to get rolling ASAP. ComponentsDoes it have lights?No. The Dual remote features a small LED safety light to use in a pinch for visibility. If you ride at night, we do recommend investing in a set of lights though. We'll have some for you to order before the campaign ends!  If I wear the wheels out can I replace them?Yes you can, just loosen a few screws and swap a new one on in about 2 minutes! You can find replacement wheels here. I just crashed and broke my _____ where can I get a replacement?You can find all replacement components here. Can’t find it? Give us a call at 833-MYMILES Payments and ShippingWhen does it ship?After we get the funds from Indiegogo, we'll build the boards and deliver them as soon as possible. How long for delivery?After we build the boards, most orders outside the US will ship direct from the factory and arrive approximately 3-4 weeks after shipment. US orders will be shipped via container to San Diego and then via courier to your door, they'll arrive approximately 6 weeks after shipment from the factory. Where do you ship?We're starting with a list of 52 countries and aim to expand this reach even further. If you find there's no shipping method for your country, you can let us know where you're from here. We'll work on the logistics and reach back out if there's a solution! In our last campaign we were able to ship 99% of orders, but there were just some locations like remote islands or countries with very strict rules that were impossible to ship to. We refunded those orders when it was clear there was no other way. If for any reason we can't deliver your board, you'll get a full refund (unless you live somewhere really cool - then maybe we'll hand deliver).  How Much is Shipping?You can check the most updated shipping rate for 52 Countries by beginning the checkout process and inputting your shipping info. The rates are calculated by country, so there may be a handful of regions (remote islands etc.) with special handling rates. If that's the case, we may reach out after building your board to collect any additional fees that apply. Note: There's an additional shipping fee for orders to Hawaii ($100) and Alaska ($120). If you order from Hawaii or Alaska, we'll email you with payment instructions when the campaign ends for the additional fee.  Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT?The backer is responsible, please check your country's import duties before purchasing. It is 0% in the US and varies internationally.  Can I test one at your office?Yes! Come cruise by the showroom in San Diego. Can I get a refund?Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here. We'll put the funds from Indiegogo directly into producing your board, and delivering each order is important for this project to work.  MiscDo I need to wear a helmet?We strongly recommend wearing a good helmet. Accidents happen (ask Rob : D ). If you value what’s inside your head, a helmet can protect it from damage. Not only that, it’s the law in many places. Bottom line: you’re responsible for your own decisions. Please don’t come crying to us if you crack your skull or get a ticket. You may see us riding without helmets from time to time and that’s a value decision we make and own. We trust you’ll make the right decision for you each time you ride.Other protective gear can save you from scrapes if you’re new to skating, riding hard or just clumsy. Please be safe out there! Can you take it on an airplane?Both the Single (108WH) and Dual (144WH) batteries can be taken on airlines only with permission from the airline. If you plan to travel via airplane, we recommend choosing the 99WH airline friendly battery, which in the US generally does not require any airline permission. We often fly with our boards and have only encountered an issue flying out of the Tijuana airport (because it was a skateboard, not because it was electric!)  Be sure to check with the airline, airport or any governing authority when you fly.  Is it legal to ride on my roads?Please check the regulations of your jurisdiction to find out where you can or can't ride. Above all, ride safely and responsibly. Your destiny is in your hands. We just help you get there faster.Are you hiring?Yes. If you love to shred and have creative talents, DM us on facebook or Instagram.

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to replace inefficient single phase electric motors with ones that are inexpensive and super-efficient, ultimately lowering your electric bill and more... 

What We Need & What You Get 

Your funding will get us to the next stage in the development of this new motor design. The next prototype will include all of our advances and will allow us to have third party testing provided by independent engineering.

Your contributions will get us to our goals and for this, you will receive 100 shares of stock for each $1.00 contributed, as soon as the new JOBS Act allows us to, slated for October, 2015. 

The Impact

Our motor utilizes the strongest portion of the magnetic field of the neodymium magnet, aligning directly with the coils own electromagnetic field at its strongest position. This does not currently occur in electric motors.

Our direct drive ultra high torque electric motor naturally lends itself to be used as a powered electric bicycle hub. Not only is our DC motors RPM easily controlled, as a motor and generator it is suited for regenerative braking, like many of todays hybrid automobiles, extending the range between recharging. Our goal is to produce a motorized hub and battery pack that will allow you to retrofit your favorite bicycle, turning it into a vehicle that will provide many years of reliable transportation.    

                                         

Inefficient single phase electric motors are consuming a large portion of our electric bills. There are least three (3) electric motors in a conventional air conditioning system and three in a refrigerator. There are many other single phase electric motors such as ceiling fans, electric drills and other tools.

We have now entered into the age of electric powered transportation. Hybrids (electric motor and gasoline engines) are now being used for the first time this year in Formula One racing. There are electric cars, airplanes, bicycles, lawn mowers, weed whackers, etc. The list goes on, and then there are electric motors for commercial uses for everything from manufacturing and school buses.

Risks & Challenges

It is always difficult to bring new concepts or products to the market. The status quo is highly motivated to push back any competition that would make them lose market share.  

We are very methodical and will use patience to move forward as we plan to enter a few key markets and grow from there.

Solving a Problem

Single phase induction motors are very inefficient.

They function by alternating field polarity.

This does not create rotation. 

Rotation must be manipulated by creating a third field, accomplished with a capacitor coil delay circuit or shaded pole. In addition rotor is powered inductively and is “twisted” to create the direction.

Many decades ago, before transistors, these motors revolutionized our society. With dwindling resources and skyrocketing energy costs, this is no longer acceptable. Today we have incredible electronic controls and rare earth magnets which allow us to produce such an efficient and powerful motor as the happy motor.

Air Conditioners Refrigeration

The majority of our households utilize single phase electricity. Therefore inexpensive single phase electric motors are used in our AC units and refrigerators. One large motor runs your compressor, one runs your condenser and one runs your air handler. They all make your electric meter spin out of control.

Our motors can lower you electric bill without the expense of a frequency drive. This converts single phase electricity to three phase, allowing for the adjustment of the frequency.

Ceiling Fans

 Ceiling fans save us energy by moving the air around thus lowing our use of air conditioning. Unfortunately the motors are very inefficient. Our motors will significantly lower the electrical costs of running these fans.

Automobiles

Electric cars are now a realty. Imagine a 20% or more extended range. Our

  motors are direct drive and do not require the expense of a transmission.

Airplanes

Electric airplanes are being used for training purposes. Electric motors are becoming common in self-launching gliders. Their range is still too limited for other applications. In our lab we are experimenting with recycling the input energy, capturing typical lost back EMF with the hopes of using the electricity to significantly improve performance.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this on to your contacts on the various social media sites and please Like Us on Facebook and YouTube.  DigiKey.com Gift Cards accepted.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Emmanuel Pena born and raised in Harlem, NY. Growing up Church has had a huge part of my upbringing. Due to this I spent a lot of my off time from school and weekends involved with church activities and clubs. My love for sharing, giving and serving began. Although I'm no longer an active member of my church, those traits are engraved in me. I've always wanted to have my own business but one that would entail the traits I hold from childhood. So where else to start than with family? My father, Victor, is 77 years old going on to 78 this year. He is strong and healthy, but as the cycle of life he is aging and as he took care of me not to long ago I must take care of him one day. That's when the idea of 9A Transportation began.

Here is a silly pic of my dad wearing my Mom's hat :

  

My partner Alci and I decided to take a leap of faith and stop working for others and built our own business, 9A Transportation. This business that would bring the quality of service that everyone deserves. 9A to providing non-emergency medical transportation services. Also offering transportation for non-medical trips to major airports and any other trips needed by our clients.

We will improve services in this industry while rather than giving shareable rides, our clients will have the privacy and comfort of going from their residence STRAIGHT to the medical facilities. Unlike our competitors, that pick up multiple clients on a route that causes a twenty-minute ride into an hour and a half ride at times. Imagine a disabled family member or friend who got injured in an accident or work. Going to the doctor or perhaps physical therapy can be a difficult task when taking public transportation or having a vehicle without the specialized equipment needed. 

There is nothing better than having a family-like atmosphere service and understanding of how essential it is to be able just to make it to these medical facilities in ease. Help us here at 9A Transportation be part of your family in giving YOU the transportation service you deserve.

Here are some pics of wheelchair accessible vehicles:

 

What We Need

9A Transportation will use the funds for:

  • Base License ($2000)
  • Permit ($1000)
  • Office Space ($4,200)
  • Equipment & Software ($4,800)

***Extra contributions will go toward obtaining insurance and for working capital. 


The Impact

Your donations will help us:

  • Bring a ride that will take our clients from their residence directly to their medical appointments rather than sharing rides. 
  • Provide this service to the ever growing "baby boomer" population. 
  • Wheelchair accessible rides in New York City will have a home to reserve rides.


Risks & Challenges

 The biggest risk we have as a company is competing with bigger companies that already exist here in New York City. Our competitors capitalize by bunching clients into a van or bus that causes extremely long trips. We want to change this way of business, people in need of medical attention or on their way to their doctors shouldn't have to wait to make it to their destinations.


Check out the Perks:


Check out our ceramic coffee mug!

                                       


Check out our soft American Apparel Jersey T-Shirt

                                    


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word by liking us on Facebook
  • Share to friends and family via social media or direct emails.
  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Check our website out for more info: http://www.9atransportation.com

THANK YOU

For all the support!

story:
How does Cliqmaps work?

Users will use Cliqmaps to explore the map and discover icons that represent “Cliqs.” It will allow individuals to interact with groups and find events according to specific interest and distance from their location. By "following" a “Cliq”. . . a user’s “homepage feed”will update with posts made by that Cliq and any others they’ve followed while browsing the Cliqmap. Participate in exclusive “In-Cliq” sessions and/or Cliqmaps events, then use “in-app” tools to collectively edit content your Cliq has captured. 



What's our cause?

                         

                                 


Shane Hidalgo grew up childhood friends with Travis Tielens and together they would co-find Cliqmaps. Shane’s smile, with his cheer and pedigree to Surf and Skate, was infectious. . . constantly lighting up a room with his presence. This campaign is built in honor of his passion for giving back to his community by actively volunteering for organizations such as “Bridge to Skate”, YMCA, Urban Surf4Kids, or hosting benefit skate events with Gravity Skateboards at orphanages in Mexico.

"He became an inspiration to our entire City, representing  genuine care and humility."   

The theme of this campaign is meant to give back to the sports that helped shape this company by playing a vital role in the upbringing of both Travis and Shane. This is Cliqmaps' reason for picking charities from both surfing background (California Surf Museum) and skateboarding background (Bridge to Skate) as beneficiaries of this campaign.


www.BridgeToSkate.org

www.SurfMuseum.org

Learn more about the faces behind Cliqmaps and why it's being created by watching this "About Us" video.




"BTS is a movement that uses skateboarding to transform the lives of youth by creating dynamic new paths to self-confidence, personal empowerment and responsibility for each other and their communities."  - Chantelle Heroux, founder at Bridge To Skate

The California Surf Museum serves as an international repository and resource center on the lifestyle sport of surfing through capturing, preserving, and chronicling its art, culture and heritage for the education and enjoyment of future generations. Also hosts of our pre campaign launch event April 24th 2015 see here: https://youtu.be/0bQCR8LIZK8
With a third of this campaign's proceeds reserved for BTS and the CSM, both 501c non-profits, we are asking for your help as we build a revolutionary tool for the world to use and help fuel the growth and reach of these two amazing charities!


What we need & What you get

Our plans for the construction and public release of Cliqmaps are in full swing. While we develop and refine this product, we need to produce a series of events and promotions to maximize the audience that awaits it's release. We need to scale our work environment and accommodate our team to sustain constant operations. If our vision excites you and/or is a cause you can relate with, please contribute to our efforts by picking one of the exclusive perks to the right.

The Impact

Cliqmaps will channel activity and become an effective motivator to go out and CREATE! We want Cliqmaps to drive a strong sense of community and fuel events that extend worldwide!


Risks & Challenges

When obstacles arise, we as a team will take a systematic approach toward dealing with them before they become a threat to our progress. We will ensure to troubleshoot our app and fix any bugs as they emerge. We believe in simple but intelligent design, so using this app will be nothing more than "self­-explanatory." We want to create a product that is quality, with a smooth user experience from the start and needing minimal upgrades as it evolves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our project that's okay! There are other ways to help!

Learn how to become a beta tester below. 

Please take what you have learned here today and help us spread the word! Connect with us using the social media widgets at the bottom of the page. From all of us at Cliqmaps and the huge-hearted people at BTS, thanks for any and all of your contributions! 

  • Become a Beta Tester!

    • Test out our app before it's available to the public and provide us your feedback! Request to become a beta tester and our staff will issue you a password to access it. YOU could rightfully claim to have helped shape the next BIG social media platform!

  • Help us Promote!

    • Represent the “Cliqmaps X BTS” movement by picking one of our exclusive perks to the right, start rocking our gear and spreading the word!

  • Become a volunteer at BTS!

    • Volunteers are always welcomed at any of our Bridge To Skate events. Come be a part of the infectious smiles and camaraderie of friends!
story_txt:
How does Cliqmaps work?
Users will use Cliqmaps to explore the map and discover icons that represent “Cliqs.” It will allow individuals to interact with groups and find events according to specific interest and distance from their location. By "following" a “Cliq”. . . a user’s “homepage feed”will update with posts made by that Cliq and any others they’ve followed while browsing the Cliqmap. Participate in exclusive “In-Cliq” sessions and/or Cliqmaps events, then use “in-app” tools to collectively edit content your Cliq has captured. 





What's our cause?


                         
                                 

Shane Hidalgo grew up childhood friends with Travis Tielens and together they would co-find Cliqmaps. Shane’s smile, with his cheer and pedigree to Surf and Skate, was infectious. . . constantly lighting up a room with his presence. This campaign is built in honor of his passion for giving back to his community by actively volunteering for organizations such as “Bridge to Skate”, YMCA, Urban Surf4Kids, or hosting benefit skate events with Gravity Skateboards at orphanages in Mexico. 

"He became an inspiration to our entire City, representing  genuine care and humility."   
The theme of this campaign is meant to give back to the sports that helped shape this company by playing a vital role in the upbringing of both Travis and Shane. This is Cliqmaps' reason for picking charities from both surfing background (California Surf Museum) and skateboarding background (Bridge to Skate) as beneficiaries of this campaign. 
www.BridgeToSkate.org
www.SurfMuseum.org

Learn more about the faces behind Cliqmaps and why it's being created by watching this "About Us" video.



"BTS is a movement that uses skateboarding to transform the lives of youth by creating dynamic new paths to self-confidence, personal empowerment and responsibility for each other and their communities."  - Chantelle Heroux, founder at Bridge To Skate
The California Surf Museum serves as an international repository and resource center on the lifestyle sport of surfing through capturing, preserving, and chronicling its art, culture and heritage for the education and enjoyment of future generations. Also hosts of our pre campaign launch event April 24th 2015 see here: https://youtu.be/0bQCR8LIZK8

With a third of this campaign's proceeds reserved for BTS and the CSM, both 501c non-profits, we are asking for your help as we build a revolutionary tool for the world to use and help fuel the growth and reach of these two amazing charities!



What we need & What you get


Our plans for the construction and public release of Cliqmaps are in full swing. While we develop and refine this product, we need to produce a series of events and promotions to maximize the audience that awaits it's release. We need to scale our work environment and accommodate our team to sustain constant operations. If our vision excites you and/or is a cause you can relate with, please contribute to our efforts by picking one of the exclusive perks to the right.
The Impact

Cliqmaps will channel activity and become an effective motivator to go out and CREATE! We want Cliqmaps to drive a strong sense of community and fuel events that extend worldwide!



Risks & Challenges
When obstacles arise, we as a team will take a systematic approach toward dealing with them before they become a threat to our progress. We will ensure to troubleshoot our app and fix any bugs as they emerge. We believe in simple but intelligent design, so using this app will be nothing more than "self­-explanatory." We want to create a product that is quality, with a smooth user experience from the start and needing minimal upgrades as it evolves.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute to our project that's okay! There are other ways to help!
Learn how to become a beta tester below. 
Please take what you have learned here today and help us spread the word! Connect with us using the social media widgets at the bottom of the page. From all of us at Cliqmaps and the huge-hearted people at BTS, thanks for any and all of your contributions! 

Become a Beta Tester!

Test out our app before it's available to the public and provide us your feedback! Request to become a beta tester and our staff will issue you a password to access it. YOU could rightfully claim to have helped shape the next BIG social media platform!
Help us Promote!
Represent the “Cliqmaps X BTS” movement by picking one of our exclusive perks to the right, start rocking our gear and spreading the word!
Become a volunteer at BTS!
Volunteers are always welcomed at any of our Bridge To Skate events. Come be a part of the infectious smiles and camaraderie of friends!

story:
Global platform connecting those who are looking for transportation with those who wish to offer one. More then 100 different types of transportation in one place. Everything that flies, swims or rides- you can find here! From the most common types of transportation (bus, taxi, boat) to the most craziest like balloon or dog slides! Offers are provided by commercial entities but also from private individuals. Everything we store on our balcon, in our garage, hallway, home, storage ect. could be used at Tripholder by others. We  increase transport stock by including undeveloped, unused forms of transport.

 

 

 

  •    tourist trip  
  • business trip  
  • moving to work  
  •  moving to everyday activities    
  • organized groups, emigrations  

 

More then 1,5 billion people travelling for tourism or business yearly. Hundreds of millions of people moving to work somehow every day or moving to another country under emigration. The world has 3 billion forms of transport. Most of them belong to private owners and are currently not in use. We have to use them. There are millions of poor regions and household’s, that need help. We need better transport optimization, to reduce carbon dioxide and to reduce energy absorption. We want  to help.

“TripHolder seems like it might be a good fit” – GSVLabs

“I came across Tripholder on Angelist and thought you could be a great fit for a demonstration opportunity at our Upcoming Phocuswright Europe event.”- Phocuswright

“Tripholder looks very interesting to us. It is inspiring to see great ideas as yours, and our mentors really can't wait to begin the workshops in Warsaw” – Startup Hub Poland

“Your project is very ambitious” – bValue Capital

“Cool idea” - White Summers Caffee & James

“Your concept is really interesting” – Tipstat

“Great market, could have very large footprint” – Sukanta

“Great idea! Love it!” – Tim

“I travel o lot both for work and leisure. Tripholder makes it not only easier and cheaper but also connects me with local culture and expands my network” – Kaia

“I love Tripholder, it changed the way I travel. Today time is money. Tripholder saves me both” – Michał

“Tripholder makes it easy to connect with locals and their culture. I love it.” – Rafal

“Great idea and real revolution in the world of travelers. Such a helpful tool, thanks” – Dominika

“Tripholder is a great service for people who are constantly on the move exploring the world"- Anna​

 

* We were invited to the accelerator GSVLabs

* We have a hundred providers so far

* They write about us

( https://mambiznes.pl/wlasny-biznes/polski-start... )

* Third place in the competition start up Business Link

 

Tripholder is a kind of sharing economy world with the peer2peer model. The innovations - our platform will combain and connect both: private and commercial offers and it's the first platform including more then 100 different types of transportation in one place! Tripholder is a tool to providers to manage and optimize their resources. We give the content management profile and reservation system to those who needs it. We implement artificial intelligence into our algorithms connecting all possible offers on one route.

Filtration of types of transport

Filtration of the properties

 

Few screens 

 

 

  •  save time and money
  • select of 100 different forms of transport
  • combines private and commercial on one route
  • book on the other side of the world or just for the city next door. 
  • generate new or more revenues 

From now You can use the types of transportation which you previously thought only. Now You can generate more adrenaline and experience with transportation at the end of the world or not far, behind the wall of Your neighbor

 

 

  •  more then 1,5 billion people travelling for tourism or business yearly.
  • the peer2peer model will be worth 900 billion of usd by the end of the year 2025.
  • 3 billion of means of transportation belong to private hands in the World

 

1. Join our community as provider or traveler.  

2. Share our campaign with your friends or family because everybody are traveling

3. Share at social media because there could be the new travelers and providers.

4. Take the chance to get the 20% discount for many of transportations

5. Support us financially in the campaign on Indiegogo, the main costs we have below:

  • Tripholder Mobile application (android, ioS) - because more then 70% people in United States for example using smartphones more often then computers. 
  •  pilot programs in San Francisco 
  • relocation and activation in  United States - because of the business and private individuals mentality but also because of the chance of develop our product,  vision and network
  • employment, including about 4 people - because it will be needed to pilot program and daily activities.
  • e-marketing campaigns - because we want to be seen,
  • patent application including 2 algorithms - because it secure our business model and potential investments of all interesting sides.

 

Transportation and travel industry is a 10 trillion giant but it excludes from its wealth the humble and small owners of private means of transportation who, if included and organized through a single transportation and tourism platform, could benefit greatly.

Tripholder platform enables private owners of means of transportation to gain new income and expand their budgets, contributing to the local economies. We deliver missing economic factor and contribute to the underdeveloped and local economies. We help to organize better travel industry, as well as help people from diverse social groups to get to their works and to travel better across large cities, minimizing traffic and improving ecological system. We give modern tools to manage paths and slopes of transports. We reduce costs of any private of transport activities and optimize resources. We hope, that Tripholder will connect hundreds of millions of people all over the world in one integrated community of travelers and owners of means of transportation, gathering on one platform all of us owning and seeking access to trip holding vehicle. People will be able to quickly find the way of “getting there“ by staying on Tripholder.

 

 We have 100+ different types of transportation in one place providing first such a service in the world. We primarily use offers from private individuals, so we could compare ourselves to being a AirBnB service for transportation. We focus at artificial intelligence algorithms by searching, combining and connecting private and commercial offers in one place or on one route. To become one of the most friendly tool for the community is the challenge and goal. Competitors are not sleeping and this is the most dangerous risk. We are not sleeping either so it's also risk for the competitors.

 

  • provide solution and opportunity for economic improvement for many people
  •  give chance to stimulate small, local as well as nationwide businesses.
  •  minimize polluting problems
  • minimize traffic jams
  • overcorwding causing parking problems
  • help poor regions and household’s
  • secure the better transport optimization
  • reduce carbon dioxide
  • reduce energy absorption

 

 

 

 

 

Don't worry, we will be glad to invite Your to our system to be the member of it. We build the global transportation community and the door is always open for everyone. We hope, that the fate will be our friend and everything will be good during the implementation. So, if You like it, just support us in different way. We will be very thankful for it.

story:
Cherry Street Bicycle Co-op

“Abundance is not something we acquire; it is something we tune in to.” (Wayne Dyer)

“Bicycles are everywhere. Why settle for just one?” (Cherry St Bikes)

Imagine a place where you can borrow a bike for yourself and a friend, or even your entire family, pick up a few healthy snacks, tune-up your own bike, or even design and build a custom bike to take home. 

Hi, my name is Marco Carmona, I’m one of the founders of Cherry St. Bicycle Co-op. Our mission is to make bikes (and trikes, and surreys, oh my!) accessible for everyone in our immediate community and beyond. Our idea for Cherry St. Bikes began when neighborhood children were using my front yard as a bicycle repair station. We realized they had no idea how to maintain their bikes and there were few local options for our under-served community to repair, purchase, or borrow a bike. Many of their parents weren’t riding with them because they didn’t own an adult bike. For months, we surveyed the community- some folks didn’t have a place to store a bike, others simply didn’t want to ride alone. But bikes are everywhere- and everyone wants to ride a bike- how could we turn plenty of predicaments into a bounty of bike-riding beauties? (Well, we think our neighbors are beautiful!) Eureka! A co-operative providing a library lending system of bikes of all shapes and sizes, along with a repair shop, shone like the sun that rises on the East Side. We soon secured a commercial location within our downtown neighborhood for our clubhouse at 132 Cherry St. and Cherry Street Bicycle Co-op was suddenly more than just an idea! Cherry Street Bikes will soon provide an option for anyone who desires to ride, from parents with children, granny with her bad knees, regular Joes, and even bike-riding beauties with special needs.

Your help and contributions will make it possible for us to open our San Antonio downtown clubhouse to the public allowing us to share two wheel bikes, trikes, tandems, large multi-passenger bikes (surrey) and special needs bikes. We’ll also house a commercial kitchen that will be available for special events and will provide healthy snacks and picnics for your bike-riding adventures! Our downtown location affords you access to all of the cool spots and landmarks that make San Antonio a wonderful place to explore.  

Cherry St. Bikes strives to provide neighborhoods with a sense of community. We are proud when we see our neighbors outside, riding together as a family, and we can’t wait to see you on a Cherry Street Bike! A growing member base will allow us to grow our bicycle fleet and eventually expand our co-operative to other neighborhoods and cities. Join us today by investing in a membership. 

Come and ride it!

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE: regardless of this campaign result, we will be able to deliver the Vela to all pre-orders and reservations with no delays, costs and design changes. This will be possible to be achieved considering the fact we have other fund sources such as another live campaign, direct sales and online email contacts.



The main feature of an electric bicycle is a powerful electric engine that helps you go up very inclined paths and commute further with more ease. The Vela has a 350w engine able to deliver up to 4 times the power of a regular cyclist.


This is a public-test-ride-video we recorded in Los Angeles with random people riding and testing the Vela for the first time.





 

If you ever need to lift it, The Vela weighs 44lbs (20kg). That's around 20% less than most electric bicycles.





With the Pure Pedal Assist System, riding the Vela is - literally - as simple as riding a regular bicycle.











 

The Vela's LED headlight not only let's traffic know you're there, but is also designed to lighten up the street and brighten your path. It is fully connected to the main system and you won't need to charge or replace its batteries. 


The taillight is also connected to the main battery and automatically turns on with the headlight. Both have a consumption of only 2~3% of the total battery energy when they are on.





A lot of time was invested in developing Vela’s Li-ion battery. We spent months thinking what would be the best solution to make the battery both a part of Vela and easy to remove and recharge between uses. It’s range is at least 20 miles (32km) on a single charge.


How to charge:

The bottom of the frame has a very strong neodymium magnet that keeps the battery safely secured to it. No matter how rustic is your path, your battery will always stay connected and you won’t have to listen to any metal hitting.


Some of the anti-theft special screws used to protect Vela's battery inside the frame.

You can also use the direct charging port without any need to remove the battery:

All connections and components have an IP65 waterproof protection degree. 






These services will be offered by many retail/partner stores distributed throughout North America, Europe and some other main locations - These locations will also provide assistance of any other kind.


Vela offers a 12 month full warranty and 5 years on the frame. 


Since 2012, the Vela has been extensively tested by numerous guys and gals to achieve a perfect riding experience, from the feedback of all these riders the Vela model 1 is an amazing bike and we proudly back that.



If you would like to personally pick up your bike or rewards in our workshop - Los Angeles - the paid shipping cost will be 50% refunded. The other half is the balance for paying government taxes which vary from country to country.



With the Vela model 1, we believe our team has reached a precise midpoint between simplicity, effectiveness, beauty and affordability for a city electric bicycle.

Our goal for crowdfunding this project is to raise part of the funds to build our workshop for assembly in Los Angeles, CA, begin production and nationwide sale of our first bicycle – the Vela model 1. To get started we need your help to raise at least US$ 35.000 in pre-orders and reservations.



 

We would like to thank every person, colleague and partner from Indiegogo for providing us with this opportunity. We deeply believe that collective funding can help ideas become a reality in the most transparent, effective and cool way for many years ahead.


Vela Model 1

To get started we need your help to raise at least US$ 35.000 in pre-orders and reservations.





 

We would like to thank every person, colleague and partner from Indiegogo for providing us with this opportunity. We deeply believe that collective funding can help ideas become a reality in the most transparent, effective and cool way for many years ahead.




Vela Model 1

Our story 

Many of us were working drivers, and we wanted to build a product that can address all of the daily pain points of working drivers.

We'll be launching new software applications & accessories for Co-pilot to continue growing its offerings.

Our community of drivers has helped us develop Co-pilot into the product it is today. 

From day 1, our product development relied on constant interviews with drivers sharing the pain points they experience every day, and this community of drivers has been our biggest source of support and inspiration.

To this day, our beta testers & the community are helping us to further polish & improve the Co-pilot, and we look forward to getting your input for future software products that will be downloaded to your Co-pilot.

story:
Driving.ca calls the RazerLift a "ground breaking" new technology that eliminates the "backbreaking labour" inherent in loading and unloading cargo from the roof of your vehicle.


Your vehicle roof: a great place to store stuff, a lousy place to load stuff.

The RazerLift gives you all the flexibility of roof-top storage, without standing on your seats or, worse yet, standing on your vehicle. And it works with the press of a button.



Easy enough for a child to operate: accessible enough for a child to reach.

It is designed to be extremely adaptable. This weekend you can go kayaking and next weekend you can go biking. Or use it for ladders during the week, and camping on weekends.


Specs & info

Capacity: 100lb of cargo (per side)

Electrical: 30 Amp circuit, connected to the vehicle. Any competent mechanic can take care of the installation. Detailed instructions will be provided.

Base unit: Passenger side. As an upgrade, a device can also be installed on the driver side (using the same RazerLift crossbars) for twice the capacity.

Control: Manual buttons, infrared and probably also a Bluetooth app on your phone.

Safety:

  • It will have overload protection to prevent the user from exceeding 100lb.
  • It will also be able to sense if it has collided with something and will stop its motion.
  • Though not shown in the video, it has a mechanism to lock the device in place while you are driving. We don't want things flying off when you're on the highway!

MSRP: Around $1,500 - $2,000 (we'll know better by the summer). With time we can order parts in bulk and that will help reduce the price. Buying it through this campaign will also keep the price down; just saying!


Installation

A relatively handy person should be able to install the unit with the help of a friend, though we expect most people will want to have it professionally installed. A competent mechanic should be able to install it in around 2-3 hours.

We will provide detailed installation instructions for either the DIY owner, or a local mechanic if you don't live near Calgary. We will also work hard to support you during the installation process by making ourselves available either in person (if you live in/near Calgary) or by phone or Skype if you live further away.

We expect the people most interested in owning a RazerLift will be those with tall vehicles. If you own a truck, SUV/crossover, or minivan then we should have you covered. We are also working on ways to secure the RazerLift to truck canopies too.

And we will also develop adapters so you can reuse your mounting towers from Thule or Yakima. This should make it possible to mount the RazerLift to almost any vehicle on the road.

Status

Tangent Engineering (an ISO certified product engineering firm) has overseen the development; the RazerLift has been designed to extremely high engineering standards. Tangent designed and built advanced stage prototypes, as shown in the promo video. We were able to support the first stage of development because of the generosity of government funding and investment capital.

Now we need some more funds to push us through to product launch. With your help we can bring this revolutionary new product to market and help reduce back and shoulder injuries.

Specifically, we need to:

  • Finalize testing of Alpha prototypes.
  • Refine the design for Beta units.
  • Build and test "market ready" Beta versions. You can get in on the action here, if you are interested.
  • Line up suppliers and dealers.
  • Ramp up sales and marketing efforts.
We continue to secure investment capital and government funding to help cover these expenses, so you'll be happy to know we are not relying exclusively on crowdfunding. Funds raised through IndieGoGo will be used for product development and buying parts.
Your help will also be instrumental in making the RazerLift a reality for many weekend warriors and trades workers.

Perks

We are extremely grateful to everybody who is helping us upgrade the vehicle cargo management market. Depending on your level of contribution we have special ways we would like to thank you.

Tier 1: 

  • Early access to the online store as soon as we are open for business.
  • RazerLift sticker.

Tier 2:

  • Early access to the online store as soon as we are open for business.
  • RazerLift sticker and key chain.
  • Your name on our website under "Supporters" (with your approval).

Tier 3:

  • Early access to the online store as soon as we are open for business.
  • RazerLift sticker, key chain and t-shirt.
  • Your name on our website under "Friends of RazerLift" (with your approval).
  • Personalized postcard from the inventor's Cross-Canada road trip this summer.

Tier 4:

  • Early access to the online store as soon as we are open for business.
  • RazerLift sticker, key chain and t-shirt.
  • Your name on our website under "RazerLift Revolutionaries" (with your approval).
  • Personalized postcard from the inventor's Cross-Canada road trip this summer.
  • Dinner out with the inventor and his team in Calgary. Travel expenses not covered.

No matter how you get involved, we thank you very much for supporting this revolution in vehicle cargo management.


Accessories

We will develop a line of accessories starting with some very simple adapters that will allow you to use your existing carrier units, to some cargo-specific mounting devices (e.g., for ladders). As much as possible we are trying to "play nicely" with the other guys. For now Whispbar and VanTech equipment should bolt straight on. Thule equipment (other than cargo boxes) should work well too, if you buy one of their X-adapt adapters. Rhino-Rack looks like it might fit, but we haven't tested it yet.

And more adapters and accessories will be developed in the future.


Other ways to chip in

Maybe you can't contribute financially. There are other ways to help us out:

  • Raise awareness. Tell your friends and family about the RazerLift. How thankful will they be when they reduce the strain on their back?
  • Connect with us via social media. Like our Facebook page. Follow us on Twitter and Instagram. We are also on LinkedIn.

story:
What is Driver B?

We're an idea right now--and we want to become an app! That's why we're here--we need YOUR help! :)

Driver B is a ride sharing company that emphasizes personalized transportation services--what this means is, on your ride, if you need to stop at 7-11 to pick up that extra bag of doritoes for those late night munches, or if you need someone to take you to a doctor's appointment, and accompany you while inside, this is the app for you! How many times have you had to run to the ATM, or pick up a bunch of groceries, or needed to just run inside a store for 15 minutes and didn't want to deal with ordering another car?

We are going to take ride-sharing, errand running, task managing, and clean up crew (just cuz it sounds good, right? :) and roll it all up into one.

How will Driver B work?

Driver B will function exactly the same way as the ride sharing companies you currently know and use – tap your phone, and your ride arrives! 

This is some of our concept graphics for the app:

The difference with Driver B, is that we will customize your needs and requirements for your ride.  Need extra assistance with luggage?  Do you have difficulty getting in and out of a car?  Do you need someone to accompany you while shopping or inside a doctor's appointment? Looking for a driver who drives 'fast' (as legally possible, of course), or a driver who doesn't mind stopping for small errands on your journey?

As everyone's needs are different, no ride is exactly the same, and Driver B will customize to the needs of each rider--for anyone!

Ride Sharing should be by the community, for the community, to support the community.  One Ride at a Time.

How did Driver B get started?

Co-founder Tara Leigh suffers from Lupus and other serious health problems, so she has become very dependent on ride sharing as a way of getting around town affordably.  Tara is the chatty sort ('hi' and 'how are you' are *not* Tara's style--within five minutes she'll know your life history or you'll know hers, depending on which mood she's in), and talking with drivers, she learned they were growing more and more dissatisfied with how they were being paid.

No drivers of course means no rides, and after the fifth driver in a week told her they were quitting due to the fact it wasn’t enough income anymore, Tara told her partner, Peter Leonas, he needed to put his techy brain on it--  “We have to fix this problem”. 

So Peter spent a few weeks developing a new ride sharing model, one that incorporates both the multiple of 'helper apps' that Tara has become dependent on, as well as a fair profit sharing model with the drivers. “Ride sharing is supposed to service you, so it should be benefitting your needs while out and around town while also creating a reasonable price model so the drivers earn a living as well."

And Driver B was born.

Who is behind Driver B?

In addition to Peter and Tara, Driver B is building a foundation team to bring our vision of a community based ride sharing company to life.

Kevin Matthews Mobile Architect and Engineer

"Technology is a tool--a magic wand--to help and shape humanity, and it's my life passion to build projects that benefit as many people as possible."  Kevin Matthews has spent the last twenty years intimately involved in all aspects of app development and production, from back in the day when the App Store was for the Ipod. He has served in an advistory capacity to multiple technology start-ups. Actively involved in all areas of development, from architecture to deployment, Kevin has also been responsible for various iOS integration for clients such as Aruba Networks (Zingbox), Trukman, Shoppler, Dufree (Dutyfree) and most recently the virtual reality app Spinnable.  "Driver B presents a fascinating challenge--I'm not interested in just developing another ride-sharing company app, I'm interested in developing THE BEST ride-sharing app available on the market.  One that functions with novelty and ingenuity, while maintaining the functionality that current ride sharing consumers enjoy."

Sarah Bucciero Director of Non-Profit Partnerships

Sarah Bucciero found her passion for non-profit after her three year old son, Carter, passed away from an inoperable astrocytoma glioma brain tumor.  "Non-profit organizations were the heart and soul of getting Carter access to the best treatment available." On her journey, Sarah experienced first hand the positive impact non-profits have on our communities, and vowed to do whatever she could to support non-profits and their mission in Carter's memory. "What excites me about Driver B, is our commitment to ensuring the revenue generated by ride sharing goes directly to where it belongs--back to the community.  I'm looking forward to connecting essential non-profit organizations with a referral code, creating a valuable revenue stream for them."

Catherine Winteringham, RN, BSN Director of Medical and Special Needs

Deeply committed and compassionate towards the needs of others, Cathy has been on the frontline of numerous healthcare innovations since the beginning of her career.  "I'm always looking for ways of incorporating technology into improving patient experiences."  Since first becoming a registered nurse in 1975, Cathy has been actively involved in the healthcare profession while providing additional support services for thousands of individuals.  "When someone is ill, or injured, or in any kind of need for special assistance, getting from point A to point B can be very difficult, yet it is *vital* for continuity of care that a patient attends all physician appointments and follow up exams.  I'm looking forward to building Driver B to be the most effective network of support for anyone who needs a ride--no matter how much assistance they require."

Support our IndieGoGo Campaign!

We can not accomplish our goal of a ride sharing company that shares the wealth without your help! (You hear that Grandma?? We need you! Not the check-book, we're doing this the Internet way--I'll call and explain later :)  We need to raise funds to build our app and pay for all of the costs associated with ride sharing – like insurance for the drivers, advertising, etc...all the boring stuff but it keeps us all safe and secure.

Every dollar makes a difference!

How will the money be spent?

Building an app is a complicated (but exciting!) adventure that involves a number of people with different skill sets.  We have put together a 'skeleton budget', in order to get Driver B rolling!



How can I get involved?

Driver B is looking for motivated and hard working people to bring our community to life! 

If you are interested in getting involved, please email: gettinginvolved@DriverB.com

Investment opportunities: Investors@DriverB.com

Press inquiries: Press@DriverB.com

We are only as successful as the community around us! We are looking forward to launching our ride sharing app that truly benefits the communities we serve!

story:
DIE DREI MIT WILLY

Unterstützer, Sponsoren, Fans und solche, die es werden wollen – AUFGEPASST!

                        Es ist bald soweit!             Bald geht’s los!

Die große Fahrt rückt immer näher und Du kannst daran teilhaben!

Wir, Arnold Schneider, Maximiliano Di Paola und Jörg Tissat 



wollen mit Willy


 über den großen Teich.

Nach langen Vorbereitungen fahren wir von August bis September 2016
mit Willy, unserem Wartburg 311 Camping, endlich los – durch die USA.

Wir starten unseren großen Trip von New York aus nach Chicago,

entlang der legendären Route 66 bis zur Pazifikküste.

Mit verschiedenen großen und kleinen Zwischenzielen, 

geht es weiter entlang der grandiosen Westcoast nach Norden -

in einem weiten Schwung über die Rocky Mountains-

und dann wieder zurück bis nach New York.


Willy will’s wissen! – und wir natürlich auch.

Halten wir alle durch? Macht einer von uns schlapp?

An der Ausrüstung soll‘s nicht liegen.

Von „A“ wie Aspirin bis „Z“ wie Zündkerze werden wir alles dabei haben.

Wir halten Dich natürlich auf dem Laufenden mit – hoffentlich - legendären Fotos und Berichten der Tour-Highlights im Netz.

Nach glücklicher Heimkehr werden wir ein Buch (Arbeitstitel – „Aufgelesen“) mit Bildern und Erlebnissen herausgeben. Der Inhalt wird sein:

Wen haben wir getroffen? Wer hat uns ein Stück begleitet?

Was gab’s für Pannen? Wie wurden wir von Land und Leuten aufgenommen?

Was haben wir erlebt?

Unsere Videoaufzeichnungen von unterwegs sollen als Doku-Film erscheinen.

T-Shirts, Postkarten und Kalender sind ebenfalls angedacht.

Bei Interesse bitte melden!

Und wie das bei solch großartigen Unternehmungen ist, freuen wir uns natürlich auf weitere Unterstützer, Sponsoren und Fans!

SEI DABEI!

Jedes „Trink“-Geld (für Willy) ist willkommen.

Beteilige Dich mit einer freien Spende oder nutze die Möglichkeit:

symbolisch einen Streckenabschnitt von der Route66 ,für 1,00€ pro Kilometer, inklusive Urkunde, zu kaufen.

Von diesen Streckenabschnitt bekommt ihr dann eure persönliche Bilderserie.

Oder:

ab19,00 € eine persönliche Postkarte mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson

ab39,00 € vier persönliche Postkarten mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson

ab69,00 € acht persönliche Postkarten mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson

ab311,00€ acht persönliche Postkarten mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson,

  ein „Die Drei mit Willy“ T-Schirt, ein Willy Kalender 2017

ab 3311,00€ acht persönliche Postkarten mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson,

  ein „Die Drei mit Willy“ T-Schirt, ein Willy Kalender 2017,

  Werbefläche auf Willy`s  z.B. vorderen und hinteren Türen.

 

Jede Spende ist willkommen und Willy kommt wieder einige Meilen weiter der untergehenden Sonne entgegen…

Und hier für alle neu dazu gekommenen Unterstützer, Sponsoren und Fans:

Unser Vorhaben gründet sich auf vier Säulen:

1.  Zum einen nehmen wir den 120. Geburtstag seit der Gründung der Fahrzeugfabrik Eisenach am 03.12.1896 als Anlass,

zum Zweiten ist es der 60. Geburtstag der Baureihe Wartburg 311. Die Produktion lief offiziell am 02.01.1956 an.

2.  Der amerikanische Autohändler Willy Witkin hat 1958 aus der ehemaligen DDR in Eisenach 1.215 Wartburg gekauft und in den Staaten über seine Autohäuser weiterverkauft.

Also fahren wir auch in Erinnerung an Willy Witkin.


Er brachte Jörg Tissat erst auf die Idee zu dieser Tour durch die USA mit einem Wartburg 311.

3.  Auch die Route66 hat Geburtstag!

Am 26.11.2016 sie wird 90Jahre jung. Toi,toi,toi .

4.  Der soziale Hintergrund ist,

dass unser Wartburg (auch "Willy" genannt) nach der Tour versteigert werden soll und der Erlös der Kinderorganisation

  "one by one" und der Kampagne „Power of 5“ zu Gute kommen wird.

Nach der Tour wollen wir auf Vortragsreise gehen.

Bücher, Kalender T-Shirts werden wir verkaufen, um auch von diesen Erlösen die Kinderorganisation zu unterstützen.

Zusätzlich sammeln wir Autogramme von Personen des öffentlichen Lebens in Deutschland und dann auch in den USA.

Einige Autogramme haben wir bereits.

Letzteres vom Fußball-Nationalmannschafts-Torwarttrainer Andy Köpke, der in Brasilien Weltmeister wurde, und Fußballeuropameister Thomas Helmer.


In Verbindung stehen wir auch mit dem Verein "Arizona Route 66" in Arizona, der zur Erhaltung der Route 66 beisteuert und mit Victor Bierschansky, einem Wartburgsammler aus LA.


Mit Victor haben wir bereits persönlichen Kontakt. Er war im November 2015 hier in Deutschland um Teile verschiedener Wartburg-Modelle einzukaufen.

Ihr findet uns unter Facebook und youtube:

„Die Drei mit Willy“

Und auf den nächsten Oldtimertreffen!

Falls ihr noch unbeantwortete Fragen habt, wir werden sie beantworten.

email: joergtissat@web.de

Viele Grüße

Die Drei mit Willy



                                         DIE DREI MIT WILLY

Supporters, Sponsors, Fans and those who want to become one- pay attention!

                               Soon it is time!      We are starting soon!

The big journey comes closer and you can be a part of it!

We, Arnold Schneider, Maximiliano di Paola and Jörg Tissat want to bring Willy over the Atlantic.

After long preparations we will finally drive from August to September 2016 with Willy, a Wartburg 311 Camping - through the USA.

The Route will start from New York to Chicago

following the legendary Route66 to the Pacific Coast

with bigger and smaller Stops on the West Coast

with a big swing passing the Rocky Mountains

and then back to New York.

Willy want to start now! - and we too!

Will we all make it? Will one of us struggle? The equipment is ready. From „A“ like Aspirin to „Z“ like … we have it all.

We will keep you on track with – hopefully – legendary Pictures and Reports of Tour-Highlights in the internet.

After happily coming home we will write a book (working title: „Aufgelesen“) including Pictures and Stories. Also included:

Who did we meet? Who was joining us? What kind of problems did we have? How did people react to us? What did we live through?

Our Videos should be produced as a documentation. T-Shirts, Postcards and Calendars are also planned. If you are interested please connect us!

As usual with such a great project we are happy for more supporters, sponsors and fans!

BE A PART!

Every „tip“ (for Willy) is welcomed.

Become a supporter with a free donation or use another option:

You can buy an symbolic part of the Route66 for 1,00€/Kilometer. You will get your very own collection of pictures from this part of the way.

Or:

from 19,00€ a personal postcard signed by an official

from 39,90€ 4 personal postcards signed by an official

from 69,90€ 8 personal postcards signed by an official

from 311,00€ 8 personal postcards signed by an official, a „Die Drei mit Willy“ T-Shirt, a Willy calendar 2017

from 3311,00€ 8 8 personal postcards signed by an official, a „Die Drei mit Willy“ T-Shirt, a Willy calendar 2017, commercial on „Willy“

Every donation is happily welcomed and „Willy“ is taking more and more steps to the sunset...

For all the new supporters, sponsors and fans.

Our adventure is based on four reasons:

1. We are celebrating the 120th birthday of the car manufacture Eisenach in 3rd December 1896 and the 60th birthday of the Wartburg Type 311. The production started officially on 2nd January 1956.

2. The American carseller Willy Witkin bought 1215 Wartburg from the former German Democratic Republic in Eisenach in 1958 and sold these in his car houses in the US.

3. The Route66 has also Birthday! On the 26th November it is the 90th birthday. Toi, toi, toi.

4. The social background is that our Wartburg (also called Willy) should be donated after our tour and the proceeds should be spend to „one by one“ (a kids charity) and the campaign „Power of 5“.

After the tour we want to travel and talk about it. We will sell books, calendars and T-Shirts to donate these proceeds to the kids charity.

Additionaly we collect autographs from famous people in Germany and the US. Some autographs we already collected. The last ones were by Andreas Köpke, the coach of the goalkeepers in the German National Football Team, who won the World Cup in Brazil and Thomas Helmer who won European Championship in Football.

We stay in contact with the association „Arizona Route 66“ in Arizona which is working to keep the Route 66 alive and with Victor Bierschansky who is a Wartburg collector from LA.

With Victor we have contact in person. He has been in Germany in November 2015 to buy some parts of Wartburg types.

You can find us on facebook and youtube:

„Die Drei mit Willy“

and at the next Oldtimer Meeting!

If you still have unanswered questions, we will answer them.

email: joergtissat@web.de


Best Regards

Die Drei mit Willy

DIE DREI MIT WILLY
Unterstützer,
Sponsoren, Fans und solche, die es werden wollen – AUFGEPASST!
                        Es
ist bald soweit!             Bald geht’s los!
Die
große Fahrt rückt immer näher und Du kannst daran teilhaben!
Wir, Arnold Schneider, Maximiliano Di
Paola und Jörg Tissat wollen mit Willy über den großen Teich.
Nach
langen Vorbereitungen fahren wir von August
bis September 2016 
mit Willy, unserem Wartburg 311
Camping, endlich los – durch die USA.
Wir starten unseren großen Trip von New York aus nach Chicago,
entlang der legendären Route 66 bis zur Pazifikküste.
Mit verschiedenen großen und kleinen
Zwischenzielen, geht es weiter entlang der grandiosen Westcoast nach Norden -
in einem weiten Schwung über die Rocky
Mountains-
und dann wieder zurück bis nach New
York.Willy
will’s wissen! – und wir natürlich auch.
Halten wir alle durch? Macht einer
von uns schlapp?
An der Ausrüstung soll‘s nicht
liegen. 
Von „A“ wie Aspirin bis „Z“ wie Zündkerze
werden wir alles dabei haben.
Wir halten Dich natürlich auf dem
Laufenden mit – hoffentlich - legendären Fotos und Berichten der Tour-Highlights
im Netz.
Nach glücklicher Heimkehr werden wir
ein Buch (Arbeitstitel – „Aufgelesen“) mit Bildern und Erlebnissen herausgeben.
Der Inhalt wird sein:
Wen haben wir
getroffen? Wer hat uns ein Stück begleitet?
Was gab’s für
Pannen? Wie wurden wir von Land und Leuten aufgenommen?
Was haben wir
erlebt?
Unsere Videoaufzeichnungen von
unterwegs sollen als Doku-Film erscheinen.
T-Shirts,
Postkarten und Kalender sind ebenfalls angedacht.
Bei Interesse
bitte melden!
Und wie das bei solch großartigen
Unternehmungen ist, freuen wir uns natürlich auf weitere Unterstützer,
Sponsoren und Fans!
SEI DABEI!
Jedes „Trink“-Geld (für Willy) ist
willkommen.
Beteilige Dich mit einer freien
Spende oder nutze die Möglichkeit:
symbolisch einen
Streckenabschnitt von der Route66 ,für 1,00€ pro Kilometer, inklusive Urkunde, zu
kaufen.
Von diesen Streckenabschnitt bekommt
ihr dann eure persönliche Bilderserie.
Oder:
ab19,00 € eine persönliche Postkarte
mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson
ab39,00 € vier persönliche Postkarten
mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson
ab69,00 € acht persönliche Postkarten
mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson
ab311,00€ acht persönliche Postkarten
mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson,
  ein „Die Drei mit Willy“
T-Schirt, ein Willy Kalender 2017
ab 3311,00€ acht persönliche
Postkarten mit Autogramm einer Amtsperson,
  ein „Die Drei mit Willy“
T-Schirt, ein Willy Kalender 2017, 
  Werbefläche auf Willy`s  z.B. vorderen und hinteren Türen. 
 

Jede Spende ist willkommen und Willy
kommt wieder einige Meilen weiter der untergehenden Sonne entgegen…
Und hier für alle neu dazu gekommenen
Unterstützer, Sponsoren und Fans:
Unser Vorhaben gründet sich auf vier
Säulen:
1. 
Zum einen nehmen
wir den 120. Geburtstag seit der Gründung der Fahrzeugfabrik Eisenach am
03.12.1896 als Anlass, zum Zweiten ist es der 60. Geburtstag der
Baureihe Wartburg 311. Die Produktion lief offiziell am 02.01.1956 an.
2. 
Der amerikanische
Autohändler Willy Witkin hat 1958 aus der ehemaligen DDR in Eisenach 1.215 Wartburg
gekauft und in den Staaten über seine Autohäuser weiterverkauft.
Also fahren wir auch in Erinnerung an Willy Witkin. Er brachte Jörg Tissat erst auf die Idee zu dieser
Tour durch die USA mit einem Wartburg 311.
3. 
Auch die Route66
hat Geburtstag! 
Am 26.11.2016 sie wird 90Jahre jung. Toi,toi,toi .
4. 
Der soziale
Hintergrund ist, 
dass unser Wartburg (auch "Willy" genannt)
nach der Tour versteigert werden soll und der Erlös der Kinderorganisation 
  "one by one" und der Kampagne „Power of 5“
zu Gute kommen wird.
Nach der Tour wollen wir auf
Vortragsreise gehen. 
Bücher, Kalender T-Shirts werden wir verkaufen,
um auch von diesen Erlösen die Kinderorganisation zu unterstützen.
Zusätzlich sammeln wir Autogramme von
Personen des öffentlichen Lebens in Deutschland und dann auch in den USA. 
Einige Autogramme haben wir bereits. 
Letzteres vom
Fußball-Nationalmannschafts-Torwarttrainer Andy Köpke, der in Brasilien
Weltmeister wurde, und Fußballeuropameister Thomas Helmer.In Verbindung stehen wir auch mit dem
Verein "Arizona Route 66" in Arizona, der zur Erhaltung der Route 66
beisteuert und mit Victor Bierschansky, einem Wartburgsammler aus LA.Mit Victor haben wir bereits
persönlichen Kontakt. Er war im November 2015 hier in Deutschland um Teile
verschiedener Wartburg-Modelle einzukaufen.
Ihr findet uns unter Facebook und
youtube:
„Die Drei mit Willy“
Und auf den nächsten Oldtimertreffen!Falls ihr noch unbeantwortete Fragen habt, wir werden sie beantworten.email: joergtissat@web.de
Viele Grüße
