The controller was ergonomically designed to deliver the most comfortable fit.Or connect through our app!  It gives you the ability to control the skateboard, battery life reminders, and route history of where you’ve been. It’s also equipped with AI, learning your movements and habits, to offer you the best riding experience by making automatic adjustments! The Hurricane X is designed with a USB port to turn your skateboard into a personal power bank. Never will you have to miss recording your adventures. Just plug your charger to the board and revive your devices.With the 1800W powerful dual motor system of HurricaneX, 17º / 30% hill climbing will not pose a problem! It's a perfect personal vehicle for you to get around.Thanks to the aluminum unibody design of HurricaneX, not only it is super strong, but it is also IPX7 Waterproof! Don't let the puddles get in your way, enjoy HurricaneX even more! Getting around the city doesn't have to be stressful and tiring, it can be stylish and fun, ride HurricaneX now and start venturing your city like.The HurricaneX team is a young and passionate team aiming to provide a solution to last mile transportation, making urban commute less stressful and tiring, but more exciting and fun! If you ever got scared off by the expensive prices of other electric skateboards on the market, which can easily be over $1000, HurricaneX is your best chance to own a personal powerful electric skateboard! Start venturing your city with HurricaneX!As our product design and testing are gearing up to the final stages and heading to large-scale product, we’d like to invite you to the last chapter of this adventure to enjoy the convenience of urban commute as much as we do.We are really excited to launch the HurricaneX that could make getting around your city a breeze. We know that the most important part of our process is the commitment we made to you and to deliver the HurricaneX to you on time! All rewards are expected to start shipping in May, 2018. We are confident in our supply chain management and production capability. However, if there are any uncontrollable factors, such as component delays or unexpected shortages, we will be sure to keep you well informed every step of the way and do our best to quickly solve the problem. We are excited to bring HurricaneX to life and get this revolutionary electric skateboard into your hands!

story:
*** Note : Final outer Body(fairing) design will be Revealed at a later stage ,And it will Be Really Beautiful***

 

"Our vision is to build the most affordable and reliable electric super-bike in the world that beats petrol powered motorbikes in their own field"

 

Introduction :

        We are an Indian start-up, developing what will be India's first electric Superbike named the EP-1, The electric Superbike will be comparable to 600-650 cc motorbikes with internal combustion engines in terms of performance, with a top speed of 250 km/h  The bike will run more than 500 km on a single charge 

The Conceptual phase of the bike is completed, which is, the complete detail design is ready, the electronics have been tested in modules and analyzed and we have done extensive virtual testing with different scenarios and different environmental conditions, theoretically we can reach 500 and above kilometers on a sport bike on one charge with our custom discharge algorithms and optimal overall aerodynamics you could know more about us and check our results out Below

After the project is completed we will be running an Electric bike Endurance Road Trip Going from Bangalore to Goa (556 Kilometers or 345 miles) For the india Bike Week on a Single charge and presenting it to all the Motorcycle fans (30,000 riders) present there

In the next steps of our project, we have plans for participating in the European Pikes Peak Hill climb challenge and set a record,

And Later We will be taking part in the Isle Of Mann TT Zero Challenge 2020, That will be a great opportunity to test out all our systems with your batteries in it.

Our Project has been Featured on,

  • Electricmotorcyclenews.net
  • NDTV car and bike
  • Gizmag
  • NewAtlas
  • MotorbikeWriter
  • Motoroids
  • Motorbeam
  • Business today
  • Wealth Builder
  • Financial Express
  • Motorcyclenews.co
  • Electrive.com
  • Motorbikes.co.uk
  • Auto.cz
  • Motoplanete.com
  • Cartoq.com
  • Acidmoto.ch
  • Scigacz.pi

Once This Project and the Endurance Run is accomplished, the media coverage in India, Europe and the US will be massive and unprecedented,

To get this project done and brought to a reality, we need your help by backing us in this endeavor

 

 

 

                                

Updates
 

Prototype testing of electric systems

We have completed the design and initial testing of the prototype Electric system consisting of a custom battery management system with proprietary charging and discharging algorithm being tested with a low powered electric motor(Not the motor bieng used in the bike)

 

 

Features

The combination of lightning fast acceleration and aerodynamic bodywork make for a fearsome sport bike.

 

Energy

An amazing liquid cooled 18.4 kWh Battery-Pack

A combination of High Density Samsung cells make up the entire Battery-Pack, With dedicated Matrix BMS system to monitor and control individual cells providing high levels of safety and efficiency

 

 

Range

More than 500 km* on a single Charge

*A total Range of 480 Kilometers on a full charge, at 70 Km/h on the highway and a range of 500 Km ~ 550 Km in the City with Active Regenerative braking

 

 

 

Drivetrain

An extremely quiet Belt Drive system

The rear wheel is driven by an Aramid Kevlar reinforced Belt drive system connected to a 40KW high performance PMSM Motor with 180nm at the shaft and 432nm at the wheel, resulting in Quiet operation and increased torque-jerk tolerance and eliminating any lubrication needs

 

 

 
 

Brakes

251 km/h to 0 km/h

The braking system consists of dual 320mm front and 245 mm rear disks with brembo calipers, reinforced with dual-channel intelligent ABS and traction control with Machine Learning developed in-house.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Specifications

    

 

Engine | Motor

  • High Performance 40KW proprietary Motor
  • Speed : 8000 RPM
  • Rated torque : 100 N.m
  • Peak torque : 180 N.m
  • Protection class : IP67
  • Cooling : Liquid cooled(Water)
  • Poles : 8

Suspension

  • Front : Ohlins USD Fork
  • Stroke : 120 mm
  • Length : 800 mm
  • Fully adjustable
  • Rear : Ohlins TTX GP **(optional) + $850
  • Showa pressurized(standard)
  • Stroke : 30 mm

Brakes

  Front

  • 320mm Dual ventelated Disks
  • Brembo Dual piston Calipers
  • Safety : Dual channel ABS With wheel contact sensors for traction control

  Rear

  • 245 mm Ventilated Disk.
  • Brembo single piston caliper
  • Safety : Dual channel ABS With wheel contact sensors for traction control

Dimensions

  • Wheelbase : 1440 mm
  • Ground clearance : 190 mm | 7.3"
  • Curb weight : 160 kg
  • Maximum(safe) laden weight : 280 kg

Electrical System

  • Solid state digital semiconductors – no fuses or relays.
  • CAN bus operated and fully programmable functionality.
  • Processor : ARM Cortex a53
  • intelligent battery monitoring
  • Real-time wheel position and speed measurement
  • intelligent braking response with traction control
  • Active Redundancy
  • Three Processor System to eliminate electrical or throttle malfunction (Fault tolerance)
  • Dual independent control systems for all electrical systems

Aerodynamics

  • Coefficient of drag : 0.44

Electric Drive

  • Stored Energy : 18.4 kWh
  • Peak power output : 414 kW
  • Matrix BMS System
  • Modular Battery system
  • Power output restricted to 230 kW
  • Aluminum honeycomb reinforced Carbon Fibre enclosure
  • Battery weight : 65 kg
  • Charging time : TBD

Warranty

  • TBD

Competitor Comparison Chart 

 

1. Comparision with 600 CC Gasoline sport bikes

2 Comparision with 1000 CC Gasoline sport bikes

 

 Range Graph Plots.

 

Plot Conditions

Total weight : 250 kg

Battery Energy : 18400 Wh

Max Torque(Limited to) : 120 N.m

Max Current(Limited to) : 120 A

Max Power(load) : 27600 W

Max Efficiency : 93%

Aerodynamics Coefficient(Cd) : 0.41

Rolling Resistance : 0.023

Face Surface : .46 M 2

Range of 708 Kilometers at the Speed of 50 Km/h

 

Range of 521 Kilometers at the Speed of 82.5 Km/h

 

Range of 140 Kilometers at the Speed of 210 Km/h

 

 

FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

1. The numbers sound ridiculous as stated on the website ,this is just Yet another startup promising the moon and requesting funding

     We understand your skepticism, The Numbers do sound ridiculous, The Range Given by us is done with limited power and speed,the numbers are tested and simulated and then published, Our current battery energy is at 18.4 Kilowatt-hours, the range figures where calculated at a limited current output of 120A , aerodynamics coefficient of .41 with rolling resistance :0.023 , face surface of 46 m2, the total weight of the bike including the rider was at 250 KG with a maximum electronics efficiency of 93%, we have close to zero conversion losses, we get a range of 521 kilometers at a limited speed of 82.5 Km/h 

But even that might not validate our claims, there already is an electric Superbike, The Lightning LS-218 which has a 150 kilowatt motor and a 20 kWh battery pack which gives 250 kilometers on a single charge, we use a motor that is 3 times less power consuming and is further limited for high range, 500 kilometers is possible with proper power regulation and electronics

2. It looks Ugly

We agree, The Outer body is just a concept and was built just to calculate aerodynamic forces, the final design will be revealed during the Bike launch, and it will be Beautiful

3. What is the current state of development for the bike? What will the funding be used for?

The Conceptual phase of the bike is completed, which is, the complete detail design is ready, the electronics have been tested in modules and analysed, the funds will be used for Complete integration, prototype iteration and Electronics and software development

4. Why Are you doing this? and why did you target a range of 500 kilometers

As charging times are high in electric bikes, it wouldn’t make sense to keep the range to 200 kilometers, there would be no actual real world use, there are no charging stations in India and even if someone keeps the motorcycle for charging in some one’s home it’ll take hours, so we had to choose between getting the range Higher, or getting the charge times lower to 15-30 mins. We got the range higher so that the person using the motorbike should charge only once a week for all the weeks commute. And not worry about anything else

We are not looking to make money in the first phase, we just want to prove that doing 500 kilometers or more on a motorbike is possible and break the belief of people that electric bikes are not reliable, 

There are already 3 Electric bikes in India with 200 kilometers per charge range, we just wanted to do something different, after the first phase there are plans to build a 500 kilometer range mid range motorbike under 3 lakhs with low powered motors and so on 

And as the first bike will be produced in less numbers, and the performance is so high, we couldn't get the price any lower

5. How do you reach 251km/hour with a 40kW motor?

40 kiloWatt is the continuous rating 55 kilowatt is the peak power of the PMAC motor, 250km/hr can be reached with 48.38 kW with a torque of 130 n.m , as the motor has proper Heat dissipation systems in place, it can handle 251 kilometers per hour at 0 degree gradient , We are trying to push the limits to test our breaking points before going to market and these are the target numbers we intend to hit, there might be some increments or decrements in top speed and acceleration

6. So if an SV650 Petrol(Gasoline) race bike with 70 hp can reach around 180 - 190 km/h. how does your bike reach 250km/h, Where do you find the extra 60 km/h?

That's exactly why we have a fairing without any extra outer features, its completely smooth, with the fairing we get a Cd of .41 and without the fairing we need a lot of wattage or power just to overcome the air resistance, without the outer fairing that our motorcycle has our Cd would reach a high point of .64-.69 depending on the rider sitting up straight or leaning down, the sv650 cannot be made more aerodynamic also because of the upright sitting position . and we would struggle to reach 200, the max speed with that configuration, we would reach 195 km/h or less with perfect conditions, 

We get our extra 60 kph just by aerodynamics and the aggressive seating posture of the person(which decreases the overall surface area for aerodynamic efficiency)

 

7.How fast will it go?

  • Economy Mode can go upto 120 km/h
  • Sport mode can go up to 180 km/h
  • Race mode Can go upto and is limited to 251 km/h

8.How far can it go?

  • Economy Mode can go upto 600 kilometers with regenerative braking Per charge
  • Sport mode can go up to 350 kilometers  with regenerative braking Per Charge
  • Race mode Can go upto 140 kilometers per charge

9.How long do the batteries last?

the Lithium ion batteries and cells used in this Bike are rated at  2000 cycles and to imporve this the cells are kept in proper condition and used with multiple safety factors in place to prevent cell overload that reduces battery life

10.Where will the EP-1 be built?

It will be built in a small city called Dharwad in India.

11.Will there be a weight limit?

The EP-1 will be able to accomodate 2 passengers or a combined weight of 160 kg (360 lbs)

12.How Much is it going to cost?

The EP-1 will be sold In three separate versions,

  1. The Commuter version will have a low power motor with a Reduced capacity Battery-pack
    and will cost around $8,500
  2.  The Standard version will have a BLDC motor with a 15 kWh Battery-pack
    and will cost around $10,500
  3. The Race version will have a 40 kW motor with a 18.4 kWh Battery-pack
    and will cost around $13,000

 

 

What You get From us :

  1. Indepth Updates of our daily and Weekly progress via Emails
  2. Discounts on purchasing the  Motorbike, (After homologation in your respective countries) 
  3. Photographs of our progress
  4. Indepth Photographs of the design
  5. Launch Invitation as part of our Extended Crew
  6. A Mankame Automotive t-shirt

 

How you can help us in making this dream a reality
 

Bringing an electric vehicle to production has high up-front costs.  Your support will help bring production cost down by allowing for larger orders on big-ticket items. Your support will also help develop next-generation tooling and fixtures for ease of manufacturing and assembly. 

Your feedback will help us continue to make the best motorbike that meets the needs of real riders.

Support from the Indiegogo community also reassures us that we are on the right path.  It also uncovers deficiencies that we might have overlooked.  With such a diverse audience, Indiegogo is a great way to stay in touch with riders of all types.

Please share our campaign through social media and your friends.

We are just one step away from making this a reality
Please Contribute, Thank you

story:
Everything about this bike light makes city riding safer, more convenient, and more enjoyable. The range of lighting outputs and modes helps you spot and avoid frequent urban obstacles, from potholes and curbs to train tracks and trash. It also makes you more visible to city drivers, including those approaching you from the right or left at intersections. And because city rides often involve pit stops indoors, the easily detachable light makes theft-prevention simple.

 

 

 

When you gain speed, the Radius™ F1 light brightens; when you slow down, it dims—and it shifts at the same rate you change speed. This ensures your visibility is always optimal for your speed, and it helps save battery power.

 

RightBright™ technology incorporates:

BMI 160, a small, quiet, energy-efficient inertial measurement device that precisely senses your velocity;

"Stepless" speed-controlled beam intensity that adapts light output to your cycling speed by smoothly shifting intensity over a range of lumens.

 

 


 

In addition to auto-adjusting brightness, SecurePulse™ technology automatically switches into a safety-enhancing pulse mode when you’re turning a corner and flashes when you’re braking to a stop, because riding at slower speeds can make you less visible to drivers.

 

 

 

 

 

After three minutes of no movement, the light’s PerfectPower™ functionality automatically switches the light to standby mode. Start moving the bike again and the light will wake up and return to default speed-controlled lighting. After 1 hour of bike inactivity, the light’s power shuts off to consume extremely low energy—because nothing is worse than accidentally leaving your light on all night and discovering it’s dead when you set off on your next ride.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Strap this low-profile remote control near your grip tape, and you can manually adjust your light settings without having to take your hands off the handlebars. Rely on the light’s auto-adjustment functionality for the majority of your riding, but have instant control over personal lighting preferences whenever you want it. What's more, it's easy to detach the remote control switch from its bracket.

 

 

 

 

Hundreds of micro lenses in combination with a reflector generate consistent illumination over both distant and close-up terrain: spot lighting hits further ahead so you’re always prepared for upcoming obstacles; flood lighting illuminates a wider area in front of your bike for superior visibility of pedestrians, parked cars, and other nighttime periphery; and side lights help motorists spot you from multiple angles—not just head-on.

 

 

 

The Radius™ F1 is easy to attach to and release from your handlebars. The bracket can be mounted to the left, right, or center of the stem, and it leaves plenty of room on your handlebars for other bike accessories (including the Radius™ F1 Bluetooth-enabled remote control). The mount and casing firmly secure the bike light for stability and super-steady lighting without jiggling, slipping, or rotation, even on rough roads.

When you want to remove the light, the bracket stays on your bike; simply disengage the lock with a 90-degree turn, and the light disconnects from the bracket—pop it off to charge it or to prevent theft if you head inside.

 

 

 

 

No dirt infiltration, no inroads for water, no damaged USB ports—simply snap the magnet-equipped charger to the light and recharge.

 

 

 

Always know how much life your light has left, thanks to an easy-to-read display on top of the casing. At full brightness the Radius™ F1 has 2 hours of luminosity.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Thanks to precision CNC aluminum machining, the Radius™ F1 provides excellent lighting accuracy and heat transfer. This smart bike light features the highest-grade materials, undergoes only best-in-class manufacturing processes, and meets the highest quality standards, virtually alleviating the need for repairs or part replacements.

 

 

 

Engineered for both aesthetic excellence and technological performance, the Radius™ F1 bike light is modern and minimalist. The sleek aluminum heat sink embraces the low-profile lens-reflector combination with no visible wires or connectors to detract from the light’s clean lines and shape, and the light’s neutral color scheme complements any bike setup.

 

 

The Radius™ F1 was constructed with rainy rides in mind—it's IPX6-rated waterproof construction ensures you’ll have long-lasting light, even in the nastiest weather and on the dirtiest roads. It’s also impact-resistant from up to 1m, because drops and spills happen to everyone.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Over 10 years of product manager experience in the LED lighting industry. 8 years of experience with high-end manufacturing supply chain.

 

Studying Industrial Design in Germany and working in the LED lighting industry for over a decade. Now take these experiences to BINOREAL.

 

10-year hardware R&D experience in mobile communication in TCL, BIRD; devote to the development & application of new electronic technology.

 

Been engaged in the mold industry for 16 years. Expertise in tooling of consumer electronics, automotive electronics and lighting products.

 

Responsible for project and supply chain management. Used to work in Schneider and BYD and has over 10 year’s experiences in NPI management.

 

Responsible to design and implement the intelligence which solves real world problems. Has been engaged in software development for 7 years.

 

 

Former industrial designer in LED LENSER. Actively engaged in all design works and communicate design intentions and new concepts.

 

 

 

 

What modes does Radius™ F1 have?

Radius™ F1 650: High(650 lumens), Med(350 lumens), Low(200 lumens), Pulse(300&600 lumens), Flash(600 lumens), Auto Mode.

Radius™ F1 450: High(450 lumens), Med(300 lumens), Low(200 lumens), Pulse(250&450 lumens), Flash(450 lumens), Auto Mode.

 

How long will the battery last in high brightness?

Both versions can run up to 2 hours in high brightness.

 

Can I charge Radius F1 and use it at the same time?

Yes, you can charge it when using it.

 

What kind of battery does Radius™ F1 use?

Both versions use a 18650 Lithium-ion battery with an LG cell.

 

Does Radius F1’s auto function have to work with a bike computer?

No, no technology integrations are required. The Radius™ F1 has a speed sensor that dictates how much light to output.

 

Can I feel the obvious brightness change when riding with auto mode?

No, Radius™ F1 is designed to imperceptibly change brightness with speeds so that the rider does not get distracted. With step-less speed-controlled light output technology the Radius™ F1 transitions between dim and bright seamlessly, with no jarring shifts in light output. Unlike other speed-controlled bike lights jump between two or three preset light levels, which can be distracting and irritating, especially when your ride involves frequent speed changes (e.g. most urban cycling).

 

How fast do I need to ride to get the highest brightness in the auto mode?

In the auto mode, Radius™ F1 adapts light output to your cycling speed by smoothly shifting beam intensity over a range of lumens. When you ride at or over 15mph, it will reach the highest brightness.

 

Can I adjust the brightness manually?

Yes, you can switch between manual mode and auto mode by double clicking the power button. Rely on the light’s auto-adjustment functionality for the majority of your riding, but have instant control over personal lighting preferences whenever you want it.

 

Can it work in rainstorms?

The Radius™ F1 was constructed with rainy rides in mind. Its IPX6-rated waterproof construction ensures you’ll have long-lasting light, even in the nastiest weather.

 

Is there a low battery indicator?

Yes, when battery power is low in using, the battery indicator will blink 3 times quickly every minute.

 

Can I use my laptop to charge it?

Yes, the charging cable of Radius™ F1 comes with a standard USB connector. It compatible with any USB power source.

 

Can I use other charging cables instead of yours?

No, Radius™ F1 uses customized magnetic charging cable. No dirt infiltration, no inroads for water and no damaged USB ports.

 

How long does it take to fully charge the light?

Radius™ F1 650: It takes 4 hours to charge the light to full capacity.

Radius™ F1 450: It takes 3 hours to charge the light to full capacity.

 

Is the remote control a separate purchase?

Yes, the remote control is sold separately because not every rider needs or wants the remote.

 

How does the bluetooth remote control work?

Pair the remote control with Radius™ F1 before first use. Strap this low-profile remote control near your grip tape, and you can manually adjust your light settings without having to take your hands off the handlebars.

 

What size of handlebars does Radius™ F1 apply to?

Application diameter: 25.4mm (1 in) and 31.8mm (1.25 in)

 

Can I easily detach the light from the unit?

Yes, when you want to remove the light, the bracket stays on your bike; simply disengage the lock with a 90-degree turn, and the light disconnects from the bracket—pop it off to charge it or to prevent theft if you head inside.

 

What is the Warranty?

We provide 30-day no-hassle return and lifetime limited warranty.

 

How much is shipping and handling?

Shipping and handling, packing and fulfilling orders will cost:

FREE in the United States (including Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Alaska)

$15 for International Order

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I am a retired Airline Transport Pilot and Heavy Vehicle Driver Trainer heading up a private Foundation for righting wrongs done to ordinary everyday people and supporting community charities.

What We Need & What You Get

We need AUD$3,500 to advertise and promote our new technology that allows any driver, anywhere in the world, especially professional drivers, to  monitor all police and transport inspector activities on our roads and be warned of any and all upcoming places where these activities are being carried out. The purpose is to slow down speeding drivers. The way the current system works it is no more than revenue raising by governments. As a pilot I can lose points off my pilot licence just the same as vehicle drivers. Pilots can be booked for speeding but the difference is that we know where all the radar systems are and that we are being monitored and we have to have all relevant information in order to plan a safe and expedient flight/trip before we depart. Drivers should also have all information and detail in order that they can plan a safe and responsible trip.

  • In return for funding the promotion, all contributors will get a licence for life for each AUD$20 donated, meaning a single licence for the first AUD$20 and one each for the following AUD$20 amounts. These can be given as gifts to family and friends. Those who buy a AUD$20 licence later will be paying a yearly fee of AUD$20 for the upkeep of the servers. Only 175 donors needed.
  • This innovation will save thousands of dollars for many as they stop receiving fines.

The Impact

will be to slow down speeding drivers and make our roads safer whilst saving thousands of dollars in not having to pay fines.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, please spread the word about this campaign so that others may benefit to the good. You can use the Indiegogo share tools. 

FUXEM @ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/385947594918592/

story:
Contributor Appreciation:

  • Each contributor will play a vital role in funding the company and accelerating the development of the Defender-One water barrier system.
  • Each contribution is so important that one of our goals is to put the names of each contributor (with their approval) on the sides of the first production Defender-One railcar(s) and make it available for viewing by the contributors and general public.  Of course, the names will be grouped and font sized according to their contribution level.
  • Because it may take 3 or more years to make the first production railcar, we will list the names of the contributors (with their approval) on our website and group them by their contribution level.
  • Finally, as appropriate, we will let our contributors know when we have reached major milestones in the development of the Defender-One water barrier system.

The Defender-One’s Uses:

The Defender-One water barrier can be used as the primary defense against:

  • Storm Surges.
  • River Flooding.

The Defender-One can be used as a primary or supplemental defense for:

  • Nuclear Power Plants located near oceans or rivers.
  • Cities/Towns located downstream of large dams.

The Defender-One can also be used to:

  • Redirect flooding river waters onto target flood plains.
  • Create flood zones to minimize flooding due to heavy rain events.

Defender-One’s Advantages:

  • It is the first “coastal” storm surge defense system.
  • Once operational and track laid, it can be moved by rail to any hurricane or storm threatened location.
  • The cost per linear mile is a mere fraction (less than 1/10) of permanent barrier solutions.

Defender-One’s Other Advantages:

The Defender-One railcars are only rolled out and positioned for a very limited number of hours before, during and after storm events.  After the storm threat has passed, the Defender-One railcars go into storage in distant rail yards.  Given the use and subsequent storage characteristics, the Defender-One, unlike large "permanent" barriers, will sustain:

  • Animal life ecosystems.
  • Marine life ecosystems.
  • Ocean and river views.
  • Access to beaches.
  • The local tourism industry.
  • Local property values.
  • The aesthetic character and life of local communities.

Use of Funds:

  • General operations.
  • Global patent legal costs.
  • Travel – including institutional investors and potential customers.
  • Salaries and Consultants as needed.
  • Other related business activities.

Inventor Background

Phillip DeLaine received his Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from the University of Massachusetts in 1985.  Phil worked as an engineer at a major defense contractor as well as several other major companies in different capacities throughout his professional career.  Over the past 20 years, Phil has been granted 6 U.S. Patents and started two other companies where he successfully developed and licensed his patented technologies to third parties.  Phil is a passionate advocate for advanced technologies, especially as they relate to the betterment of our society.

The Team:

Several highly skilled business professionals have volunteered their time to this project and plan to join the company as soon as sufficient capital is raised.

The Timeline:

story:
Pop Kitchen: A Completely New Invention

The Pop Kitchen was designed and built from the ground-up for anyone looking to enjoy the convenience of having a complete culinary workstation at their fingertips, no matter where. The Pop Kitchen is at home in a school garden, backyard, on a balcony, next to a tiny house, camper, or even in a loft apartment. When not in use, the PK folds up for easy transport or storage.

Key Features


  • Mobility is Key: Pop Kitchen is extremely portable. You only need one person to lift it into a car, so you can take it anywhere. Large durable wheels allow it to roll over bumpy, uneven terrain.
  • Setup is Swift: Unlock and lift the folding table, extend the legs, attach the side shelf and you've got yourself over 5-1/2 feet of usable kitchen counter space. 
  • On or Off-the-Grid Use: Hook up the sink to a lead-free garden hose at home, or use a hand pressurized water tank for use on the road. Waste water drains into the garden for grey water irrigation or into a receptacle. The stove runs natively on isobutane canisters or with an LPG adapter which is sold separately. 
  • Practical Food Preparation: Use the full size 15" sink  to fill a stock pot; prep away on the 18" food-safe side table or recessed cutting board. Fire up the 12,000 BTU burner to boil, stir fry or sauté. Store and organize ingredients and equipment in the enclosed storage area.
  • Safe, Durable, Easy to Clean: Type 304 stainless steel is the industry standard for food safety. It also looks great anywhere, and cleans easily with a paper towel or cloth. Stainless construction also means no corrosion in the harshest outdoor environments. 

Our Fundraising Goal 

Our funding goal will be used to:
  • Continue research and development of our final product design
  • Evaluate, revise and finalize our 3-D solidworks files
  • Design shipping and retail packaging
  • Complete tooling and launch our first small-batch manufacturing run
  • Donate Pop Kitchens to our Community Partners

The number of Pop Kitchens manufactured in the first production run will be dependent on the level of support we achieve.

A limited number of fully-functioning beta units will be made available to our Indiegogo supporters as one-of-a-kind perks. 



Manufacturing


We are developing our Pop Kitchen prototypes in Ventura, California at Trupart Manufacturing.  Shane Prukop, a 3rd generation metal fabricator founded Trupart in 2004, which grew from his grandfather’s factory established in 1973. Shane makes everything from Patagonia’s River Crampon, to intricate parts for the medical and aerospace industries. Trupart has so successfully embraced green manufacturing methods as to be recognized by the California legislature for practicing  environmentally sustainable manufacturing techniques while increasing profitability and creating new jobs.

Working closely with our manufacturer to meet timelines is a priority. Creating the highest quality, most durable product possible is our mission. This all takes a great deal of oversight, so we will be on-site every step of the way to ensure the end product is something in which we will take pride, and that you will enjoy using for years to come.


Our Community Partners

We have chosen three non-profit Ventura County community organizations dedicated to garden-based learning and food insecurity issues to each receive a fully-equipped Pop Kitchen and training at no cost if we reach our funding goal.

Our community partners and IndieGoGo supporters will be asked to road test their units and then give us suggestions for improvements, accessories, and ideas for future features. We will incorporate some of these refinements into our first full production run in 2016. Features currently in development include a built-in bluetooth speaker, spice rack, insulated cold storage area, shade canopy, custom frame colors and an outdoor cover.


Born in a School Garden


I've spent decades working with restaurants, hotels and on the comedy cooking show, Dinner & A Movie. Most recently I've been devoting a great deal of time to teaching food literacy in schools. Since I give classes in places like gardens or classrooms that typically don't have a dedicated cooking area, I usually end up dragging equipment out to the location and then trying to set up some kind of a food prep area on the fly. As you can imagine, this gets old fast.




After speaking with other chefs and educators who face the same challenges, it became clear that there was a real need for a portable, professional-grade culinary workstation. I decided to invent something to fit the bill.  I'm a chef, not a designer so I knew I needed help.

I lucked out in finding a design visionary in my own Ventura County backyard who was excited by the challenge. Gavin Studer and I got to work in February 2014 and rolled out the first PK prototype 6 months later. I was astonished by its portability, ease of use, and utility all in one compact package. My instincts told me that this innovative device could be useful not just in schools, but to anyone who is passionate about cooking and eating well, regardless of the location. 




We've been field testing our Pop Kitchen prototype for the better part of a year; sharing it with garden educators, chefs, fisherman, farmers, caterers, and backyard barbecuers. The most common response thus far has been "when can I get one?"

That's why we're here asking for your support. We believe this device can improve people's lives, encouraging them to cook together, eat healthier and spend more time outdoors.

–Chef Claud Mann, Co-founder, Co-inventor


The "Swiss Army Knife" of Food Prep


After Claud outlined his criteria, it became clear that this device needed to become the Swiss Army Knife of food prep equipment: portable, foldable, affordable and virtually bullet proof. Plus it had to include a sink, stovetop , sanitary cutting surfaces and plenty of storage. 

I challenged myself with creating a piece of equipment for a rigorous outdoor environment -like a school yard- while also keeping costs down. In my research I found a 1944 military field desk – essentially a minimalist crate designed for transport that unfolded into a large desk. I used this concept as a springboard for the new design.

This is when the concept started synthesizing for me. I wanted to create a modern version of the classic field desk.
- Gavin Studer, Co-Founder & Designer

Our Core Values

Our most critical challenge continues to be staying true to our core values while meeting a realistic consumer price point for the Pop Kitchen. From the beginning, we have aspired to both manufacture and assemble the PK domestically  rather than overseas, even if costs are somewhat higher.
We believe that it's possible that if more companies did their manufacturing work domestically, it might help create local jobs, boost the economy and potentially reduce our carbon footprint.
While manufacturing costs directly affect the retail price, there are also hidden social and environmental costs with which we all must grapple daily in our respective roles as consumers and business people. Although there are no easy answers, we feel it's important for all of us to continue asking the hard questions. 

Challenges

With the PK's various parts and hardware, we are prepared to encounter challenges as we move ahead. For example, after rigorous field testing we eventually discovered that the sliding cutting board design which you currently see in the photo and video doesn't meet our standards for durability and sanitation. The next generation side cutting board is re-designed to be detachable for sanitizing and interchangeability.

The logistics of sourcing, assembly, warehousing and shipping will also take a great deal of coordination. To meet those challenges we will start small, and work closely with our partners and mentors to create the systems needed to ensure clear communication from the beginning of the supply chain to customer delivery.

Gavin is both a designer and project manager by training. He has seen complex building projects through from concept to completion. Claud also has an intimate knowledge of production deadlines, budgets and timely project delivery after co-producing a national television program for nearly two decades and co-publishing the James Beard Award winning Edible Ojai and Ventura County Magazine. Our mentors include The Ventura County EDC Manufacturing Assistance Program who will advise us as needed.


Timeline


Technical Specifications


  • Dry Weight: +/-70 lbs (Final Weight TBD) 
  • Storage Area Volume: 4 Cubic Feet 
  • Open Dimensions: 67” Length x 18” Wide x 37” Height 
  • Closed Dimensions: 20” Length x 18” Wide x 37” Height 
  • Effective Work Surface Area: 8.45 Square Feet
  • Burner: 12,000 BTU
  • Sink Size: 15"

Meet the Team

Gavin Studer


Claud Mann

Making "Cold Feet"  for The Bachelor


Watching Friday Night Lights and Plating up "Personal Fowl"  



Other Ways You Can Help

We know that support comes in many ways, including sharing the PK project with people who you think would be interested in our mission, like gardeners, teachers, food activists, chefs, and anyone who loves cooking, spending time outdoors or teaching kids the beauty of eating real food.

  • Remember to use the IndieGoGo share tools, they really work!
  • Follow and share us on Facebook and Twitter
  • Tell all your friends (and even people you don't like)
  • Teach a child how to cook something
  • Plant a vegetable garden
  • Join a CSA and support your local farmer
  • Cook a nice meal for someone who lives alone
story_txt:
Pop Kitchen: A Completely New Invention
The Pop Kitchen was designed and built from the ground-up for anyone looking to enjoy the convenience of having a complete culinary workstation at their fingertips, no matter where. The Pop Kitchen is at home in a school garden, backyard, on a balcony, next to a tiny house, camper, or even in a loft apartment. When not in use, the PK folds up for easy transport or storage.





Key Features






Mobility is Key: Pop Kitchen is extremely portable. You only need one person to lift it into a car, so you can take it anywhere. Large durable wheels allow it to roll over bumpy, uneven terrain.

Setup is Swift: Unlock and lift the folding table, extend the legs, attach the side shelf and you've got yourself over 5-1/2 feet of usable kitchen counter space. 

On or Off-the-Grid Use: Hook up the sink to a lead-free garden hose at home, or use a hand pressurized water tank for use on the road. Waste water drains into the garden for grey water irrigation or into a receptacle. The stove runs natively on isobutane canisters or with an LPG adapter which is sold separately. 

Practical Food Preparation: Use the full size 15" sink  to fill a stock pot; prep away on the 18" food-safe side table or recessed cutting board. Fire up the 12,000 BTU burner to boil, stir fry or sauté. Store and organize ingredients and equipment in the enclosed storage area.

Safe, Durable, Easy to Clean: Type 304 stainless steel is the industry standard for food safety. It also looks great anywhere, and cleans easily with a paper towel or cloth. Stainless construction also means no corrosion in the harshest outdoor environments. 
Our Fundraising Goal 

Our funding goal will be used to:

Continue research and development of our final product design


Evaluate, revise and finalize our 3-D solidworks files


Design shipping and retail packaging


Complete tooling and launch our first small-batch manufacturing run

Donate Pop Kitchens to our Community Partners
The number of Pop Kitchens manufactured in the first production run will be dependent on the level of support we achieve.
A limited number of fully-functioning beta units will be made available to our Indiegogo supporters as one-of-a-kind perks. 


Manufacturing

We are developing our Pop Kitchen prototypes in Ventura, California at Trupart Manufacturing.  Shane Prukop, a 3rd generation metal fabricator founded Trupart in 2004, which grew from his grandfather’s factory established in 1973. Shane makes everything from Patagonia’s River Crampon, to intricate parts for the medical and aerospace industries. Trupart has so successfully embraced green manufacturing methods as to be recognized by the California legislature for practicing  environmentally sustainable manufacturing techniques while increasing profitability and creating new jobs.
Working closely with our manufacturer to meet timelines is a priority. Creating the highest quality, most durable product possible is our mission. This all takes a great deal of oversight, so we will be on-site every step of the way to ensure the end product is something in which we will take pride, and that you will enjoy using for years to come.


Our Community Partners

We have chosen three non-profit Ventura County community organizations dedicated to garden-based learning and food insecurity issues to each receive a fully-equipped Pop Kitchen and training at no cost if we reach our funding goal.


Our community partners and IndieGoGo supporters will be asked to road test their units and then give us suggestions for improvements, accessories, and ideas for future features. We will incorporate some of these refinements into our first full production run in 2016. Features currently in development include a built-in bluetooth speaker, spice rack, insulated cold storage area, shade canopy, custom frame colors and an outdoor cover.


Born in a School Garden


I've spent decades working with restaurants, hotels and on the comedy cooking show, Dinner & A Movie. Most recently I've been devoting a great deal of time to teaching food literacy in schools. Since I give classes in places like gardens or classrooms that typically don't have a dedicated cooking area, I usually end up dragging equipment out to the location and then trying to set up some kind of a food prep area on the fly. As you can imagine, this gets old fast.





After speaking with other chefs and educators who face the same challenges, it became clear that there was a real need for a portable, professional-grade culinary workstation. I decided to invent something to fit the bill.  I'm a chef, not a designer so I knew I needed help.
I lucked out in finding a design visionary in my own Ventura County backyard who was excited by the challenge. Gavin Studer and I got to work in February 2014 and rolled out the first PK prototype 6 months later. I was astonished by its portability, ease of use, and utility all in one compact package. My instincts told me that this innovative device could be useful not just in schools, but to anyone who is passionate about cooking and eating well, regardless of the location. 



We've been field testing our Pop Kitchen prototype for the better part of a year; sharing it with garden educators, chefs, fisherman, farmers, caterers, and backyard barbecuers. The most common response thus far has been "when can I get one?"
That's why we're here asking for your support. We believe this device can improve people's lives, encouraging them to cook together, eat healthier and spend more time outdoors.
–Chef Claud Mann, Co-founder, Co-inventor

story:
About our idea

We are just a couple. Not a company.

We came up with an idea of sharing wishes between your friends and family members via phone numbers. Everybody can use it on birthday, wedding day, Christmas, ....

So we decide to create a free service and applications for all three major operating systems (iOS, Android and Windows). We want to keep this service free all time because we believe, that only free service like this can succeed.

Applications will work offline and synchronize wishlists when you are online. This is huge advantage because you no need internet in all time and application will be much faster.


We get this idea in Christmas time and because we are soon getting married :) .
This is logo of Wishinger application:  
 


Why we need contribution?

Like we mentioned above - we are not a company.

So starting with this service will be hardest part. We already almost finished development of core service (sharing wishlists, SMS service, cloud data storage) and already started development on mobile applications. We needed some devices for test for all operating systems and for iOS we need Macbook.

But now hardest part seems to be cost for SMS (we need to send verification SMS and sharing notification SMS).

You can find some calculations on our site: www.wishinger.eu
Per one person is there multiple SMS needed (registration and verification SMS, sharing wishlist SMS notification).

It was hard to say target price because more people cost us more SMS, so we set as target goal 20,000.00$ - it can cover at least part of initial costs.

Sharing wishlists via phone number is one of most important part of our service. You can use and register Wishinger application very easy like WhatsApp, Viber, Telegram, .... and you no need any other registration steps.
Without this the service has been not used with many people because hard registration will discourage most of them.


The Impact

We think that most of us know the feeling when you receive gifts but you can imagine more useful things in that price. So with our service can everybody create his own wishes grouped into wish lists and share them to people. Because application and service will be free, these people can install Wishinger application and they automatically see your wishes.

For example, if you want a book for birthday, you can add information about it into Wishinger and if someone bought it, then other people will see it like "already bought" (of course you will not :) ).

So advantages are for all of us:

  • Avoiding inappropriate gifts
  • Everybody will know what you really wants
  • Avoiding duplicating gifts
  • Make buying gifts more simple




Risks

There is some chance, that people will begin use our application too fast and advertisement in our application will not be enough to cover our operating expenses. If this will happen, we will need ask money for installing application on mobile for a short time or disable some SMS features even if it is a one of key features.

But we hope this will never happen and this crowdfunding is good way to avoid this. We mentioned it because we want to stay transparent and clear to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute our service, please share our site on social services. You can share one of these links:

www.wishinger.eu
Facebook - Wishinger
Google+ Wishinger
Twitter - Wishinger

Thank you very much for supporting our project and we both hope that Wishinger bring us more appropriate gifts even on our wedding :) .

Please watch our video on YouTube:

story:
About Minimula L

Minimula is designed to be a simple, lightweight, affordable way to glide through the parts of your journey you used to hike, from the distant parking lot or mass transit station directly to your door.

Appearance -  Originality, elegance, concision, the minimula L combines function with comfort wrapped in a beautiful modern aesthetic.

Performance - A safety, comfort, fast ride, the speed of 30km/h(18mph) and range of 30~40km (18~25miles). With front and rear suspension,  EPS brake and mechanic brake, Minimula L takes you from A to B in comfort and style. 

Technology - The Minimula is on the cutting edge of electric scooter technology, comes with an intelligent animation LED display and smart APP. Coming in at only 22 lbs (9.8kg), the Minimula L is very easy to transport.

 

 

Why get a Minimula L?

About the industrial design

Minimula E-scooter design follow the minimalist design and  sleek line design style, each line of the scooter has been modified. Let the scooter has smart aura and more close to people.

 

Embed LED display

Minimalism design style of handle combines with animation display. It will show various working condition of the scooter, rich expressions, human-interactive.

 

Powerful motor wheel with fascinating light ring

The light ring in rear-wheel will turn on when the speed over 20km/h(12mph). In the darkness, the shining light ring is ultra cool and eye-catching. The ring light is also a kind of alert for pedestrians and vehicles. Another, APP can control the light ring as well, you can adjust the speed of light.  

 

With front and rear suspension​, Driving more smoothly

Minimula L front wheel is 8inch pneumatic tire, stable and steady with excellent shock absorption. Rear motor wheel is inflation free tire, to avoid burst accident. With front and rear two suspension,make the  driving more smoothly.

 

Squat free folding system​

Only 3 Steps to fold, unlike traditional folding structure which will shake lightly, the unique folding system is very solid in running, making the scooter a compact package to take  the train, put in your car or stash under your desk. 

 

Personality rubber mat

The customized rubber mat with 3D detail provides a softer step on feeling compare to traditional non slip sticker. And more easy to clean.

 

Colours to match your style

We know everyone has different tastes, which is why we’ve Minimula available in 4 distinct colours: Metal Black, Shiny White, Masarati Red, Blueish Green. So pick your favourite colour!

 

Storage bag

Minimula scooter is the lightest and powerful in the world, weighing only 9.8kg(22lbs) and comes with a carrying  bag for convenient transportation and  storage. Simply fold the unit, and you're on your way.    *The storage bag only for before 100 backer

 

 

 

Technical Standard

 

 

 

* expected retail price may vary from country to country

 

 

Enhance Your Commuting Experience

Remote control (Only for Ordinary version)

The key can remote control the scooter to turn on, turn off and locked. You will hear the xylophone sound with the command.  It's more convenience and more easy.

 

APP Instruction(Only for Bluetooth Version)

（available languages: English, Korean, French and Chinese）

The mobile app is how you interact directly with the e-scooter and the context in which you travel.   It tells you info like speed, distance, step-by-step track , friends, performance and all sorts of stats on your riding.

  1. Choose language. Currently there is four languages English, Korean, French and Chinese.
  2. It tells the daily mileage and the low carbon status(the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions) in the week.
  3. The battery page tells the battery rest and the relevant distance it could run. It will remind to charge when the rest battery is lower than 20%. User could turn off the reminder for the current charging loop. ( Notice: Click and set the distance( between 20 and 30km) according to the specific model you purchased).
  4. Set the maximum speed for different users.
  5. It shows the daily track, daily mileage, average speed and the time you saved after using the scooter instead of on foot.
  6. It shows the ranking of weekly mileage. Click the user you could see their location and basic information.

 

 

Package

The packing including the inner carton and outer carton. The packing is good enough , they can stand the rehandling on transport. When you receive the goods, you will be a surprise. 

                                                inner carton & outer carton 

 

 

Why crowdfunding?

It allows us to gain valuable insight from customers about our current and future products. Best of all, it allows us to focus our energies on innovating and bringing new products to market.

Our dream is to make riding accessible to everyone. And we believe Minimula can help us reach that goal an affordable, versatile e-scooter that is fun to ride. E-scooter is fun, convenient, good for both your life and the environment. also something we are deeply passionate about. 

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q:The price is very low for electric scooter. Why is that?

A: Our goal is to make E-scooter the transport of choice for people across the globe. We have worked long and hard to create an e-scooter that is not only affordable, but also made of quality components. To help bring Minimula to life, we are offering an exclusive 55% discount off MSRP to those who support our campaign.

Q: How can you ensure such a low price?

A: We are both suppliers and manufacturers for Minimula. We have extensive experience in sourcing and manufacturing produts and components. This is a key factor that enables us to maintain a low units cost based on volume. The electric system is design under CE/RoHs/FC regulations. With increased sales and production volume. We are confident that we can ensure a low price, even after the campaign has ended.

Q: Can I order Minimula L even though not live in US? 

A: Yes, we deliver Minimula L anywhere in the world.

Q: I can't see the battery - where is it? 

A: Batteries are not something you should be spending your time looking at - so it is well hidden in within the middle frame, protected by a locking mechanism.  

Q: Can the battery be removed or changed?

A: Yes. The battery is designed in such a way that you can change it or replace with 2 easy steps that takes less than 5 minute. 

Q: How much does shipping cost? 

A: Shipping is set to $150 USD due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our factory. It is also one of the reasons Minimula price is so low, as there are no intermediary between you and the factory.

Q: When will shipping start? 

A: The first batch will begin shipping in June 2017.

Q: Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT?

A: The backer is responsible, please check your country's import duties before purchasing. It is varies internationally. You can check this comprehensive list to get started.

Q:How can I contact you?

A:You can log in our official website at http://www.minimula.com

or email us anytime at sales2@minimula.com 

or like us on Facebook at https://m.facebook.com/MinimulaElectricScooter/ 

or follow us on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/?hl=zh-cn

We are confident that we can ensure a low price, even after the campaign has ended.Q: Can I order Minimula L even though not live in US? A: Yes, we deliver Minimula L anywhere in the world.Q: I can't see the battery - where is it? A: Batteries are not something you should be spending your time looking at - so it is well hidden in within the middle frame, protected by a locking mechanism.  Q: Can the battery be removed or changed?A: Yes. The battery is designed in such a way that you can change it or replace with 2 easy steps that takes less than 5 minute. Q: How much does shipping cost? A: Shipping is set to $150 USD due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our factory. story:
The Story behind

When I moved from a state with dual license plates (Front & Back) to Florida, which requires only the rear license plate, I was left with an empty and ugly spot in the front. This was the moment when I decided to create my 3D removable attachments, because there is nothing similar in the market, and because people need an alternative and innovative way to decorate and personalize their car.

BEYUUS will now give you the flexibility and power to decorate your car based on your mood or occasion.

BEYUUS are 3D attachments made with super durable ABS plastic that can be used in almost every license plate; we are working on many themes from where you will be able to choose from, giving you the freedom of constantly updating the looks of your car.

BEYUUS are also interchangeable depending on the model, giving you the opportunity to collect and easily install them.

BEYUUS can also be illuminated, with waterproof LED lights = remote control, that will be providing different color options, without the need for complicated wiring,

BEYUUS will not block the view of your license plate.

BEYUUS for Front License plate (for states like Florida)
 
BEYUUS for Front Lower license plates (for states like California or New York)
 
BEYUUS for Front  & Back  Side license plates
 
 

Why we need your support

We are currently working on new exciting designs, but we need your help to move this project to the next level so that we can reduce the costs of manufacturing, expand our selection, and start full-scale production.

By supporting us, you will be the first ones to receive the BEYUUS, the first members of this new community; you will also receive future discounts and will be able to acquire future limited edition models. Our company is focused on innovative designs, but also on spreading a positive message and you will be the carrier, you will decide which message to share!

Community-oriented and client based.

As part of this new concept, throughout the year there will be opportunities where you will be able to submit your unique design, and the BEYUUS community will decide which one will move on to the next phase to be produced.

Be "You", join us, spread the word, we really need your help.

BEYUUS are Patent Pending

Legal Disclaimer: Laws concerning this product vary from State/Province. Your State/Province may prohibit certain lights'colors on public roads or restrict its use to novelty plates, show car use or off-road areas only.  The manufacturer and retailer assume no responsibility for any use or application of this product in violation of any applicable law. Before installing this product, please check your State/Provincial and Local/Municipal laws and regulations.

story:
Buy a Kupper Mount Bike Rack Today and It Will Ship to Your Home in August 2019 for only $99, a 50% Discount Until 6/18/2019!

 

Watching these short YouTube videos will answer 99% of your questions!

1st Step - Watch this In-depth Kupper Mounts Close-Up Product Review (1:10 minute video)

2nd Step - Watch this Fast, Easy, 2-Minute Kupper Mount Installation  (1:29 minute video)

 

1. What are we selling?

Kupper Mounts Suction Cup, Vacuum-Powered Bike Racks!

 

2. Are they safe enough to transport my $10,000 bike?

Absolutely! In fact, they have been safety-tested by leading trade publications including this GearJunkie.com product safety test review.  Read it to answer all your safety-related questions.

3. How do they work?

Kupper Mounts utilize very powerful, vacuum-powered suction cups that have been used for many, many years by many different industries for safely securing and moving heavy and very large sheets of double-paned 1/2" thick glass skyscraper windows, which can weigh up to 800-lb.,​ and/or stone slabs weighing more than 1,000-lbs. during the construction of skyscrapers and large buildings. 


 

4. Have you ever seen anyone climbing a huge skyscraper on TV with vacuum-powered suction cups fall off? 

No. And you never will. Unlike common lick and stick suction cups used commonly in showers, the Kupper Mounts uses a special type of vacuum pump that sucks out all the air and forms a very powerful seal with approximately 450-lb. of suction power.  

If it can hold a 200-lb. man and keep him from falling from 40 stories up, then you should have extreme confidence that it can certainly hold a 45-lb. mountain bike, road cycle or BMX bicycle.  It even comes with a safety gauge that you can check with a 1-second glance to make sure the seal is very secure.  Not sure? Just give it a couple of pumps to create a stronger seal.

Unlike common "Suction-Cups," Kupper Mounts uses patented "Vacuum-Cup" suction technology that creates a vacuum-powered seal using a specially engineered UV-protected rubber cup that maintains a long-lasting seal.

If they can be trusted to hold extremely heavy glass windows while building a 40-story skyscraper, they are guaranteed to hold up to a 45-pound bike securely going up to 90-mph and are protected with Kupper Mounts' Product Liability Insurance! 

All of our Kupper Mounts bike racks are 100% Satisfaction Guaranteed!

Skeptical? Read this "In-depth GearJunkie Safety Test" of Vacuum-Powered Suction Cups

5. Is there a big demand for vacuum-powered suction cup bike racks?

Yes, indeed there is a huge pent up demand for these types of bike racks. Most bike racks cost around $300 to $400 per bicycle carried. And that doesn't include the price to install a luggage rack, a trailer hitch or a wide variety of safety braces and straps that are needed to secure more expensive bicycle racks that can add hundreds of dollars to the total cost of ownership.  

Even at the full retail price of $199 for a Kupper Mounts after the crowdfunding campaign is completed, our bike racks will still be priced more than $100 to $200 less per bike.  

To make things worse, more expensive bike racks secure the bike by its frame, which is bad when you load up a dirty, gritty, muddy bicycle because as you drive roads with bumps and curves these bike racks will scratch your favorite bike's fancy paint job and stickers. 

Other bike carriers that place bicycles on trays allow bikes to bounce all around, which breaks all kinds of parts as 4 bikes stacked too close together rattle, bounce and rub on each other. If you own one of these types of bike racks you should know precisely what we mean. We know we used to own them too and got sick and tired of our bikes being damaged on road trips. 

All bike racks add resistance to a cars airflow profile, even when there are no bikes loaded, which significantly reduces gas mileage and make your drive to and from work a noisy experience.  Bikes will always make noise when loaded. And it is a total pain in the ass to remove most bike racks due to a tangled web of straps, braces and other stuff. 

The coolest thing about Kupper Mounts bike racks is that they install in less than 120-seconds and can be removed even quicker. So instead of worrying about someone stealing your bike rack while your riding, you can simply take our bike rack off and store it safely in the trunk so you don't have worry while you're out riding. 

In fact, according to a Analytical Research Cognizance (ARC) industry research report, vacuum-powered, suction-cup bike racks are the fastest growing segment of the automobile bike rack industry because they don't need a luggage rack or trailer hitch and can be installed on any rental car, SUV or truck and are small enough to be used for airline travel with bicycles!

 

Kupper Bike Rack Mounts are one of the smallest, compact, portable, secure, convenient, easy to travel with & quick-to-install bike carriers in the world! No luggage rack or trailer hitch required.

6. How does Kupper Mounts stack up to the competition?

Here is a cool graphic we put together for a some trade publication's product reviews. As you'll see Kupper Mounts will win every time based on its engineering design's features and benefits. 
 
Even more important is the price. Don't you get sick of having to shell out $500 plus accessories for a bike rack?? We did. It is one of the main reasons we invented the Kupper Mount bike rack in the first place. Instead, we offer a bike rack that is simple, compact, easy-to-clean, easy-to-store when not in use, easy-to-install/remove from your vehicle and doesn't make a lot of noise compared to other bike racks. And it doesn't damage your bike on bumpy roads because it only touches the forks and the back wheel rim. 
 
Competitive Analysis - Kupper Mounts vs. Other Popular Bicycle Carriers 

Small Footprint. No luggage rack or trailer hitch required. Easy to Install. Mounts on Any Vehicle!

 

7. What's Included with a Kupper Mounts Perk/Reward?

The Kupper Mounts Bike Carrier Includes All of the Items Pictured Above

  1. Front Kupper Mount: This secures the bike’s front forks
  2. Rear Kupper Mount: This secures the bike’s rear wheel
  3. Security Tether: With a steel-braided line running though the center of the strap, this locks your bike to your vehicle. Simply loop through bike frame and drop the end into your vehicle’s door, trunk, or hatch.
  4. Cam-Buckle Strap: Use this in place of the Rear Kupper Mount when mounting your bike on the rear of a vehicle where the Rear Kupper Mount can’t be applied. Simply loop through your rear stays or wheel, attach flat PVC coated hook to either the bottom lip of trunk lid or the bumper, then cinch tight.
  5. Pedal-Stay Velcro Strap: Wrap this around your crank arm and bike frame to keep your pedals from back-spinning while traveling down the road.
  6. All-In-One Carrying Case: Your Kupper Kit has a home! Store your entire Kupper Mount System in the conveniently portable carrying case when not carrying your bike. * Carrying Case image is only for representation purposes and is not the final case design. 

 

Shipping

At the end of the campaign, standard shipping charges will be added via Backerkit. Right now we are estimating $12-15 for domestic shipping in the United States and $25-$35 for shipping to international locations. Please note these are estimates.  Stores/dealers that order 10, 20, 36 & 72 packs can use their own preferred shipping method.    

 

How to Use a Kupper Mounts 

The Kupper Mount is setup and ready to use right out of the box.

No complicated assembly or tools are required! 

  • Locate the position needed for the Front Kupper Mount and Rear Kupper Mount.
  • Clean the contact surface, if needed, and the face of the Kupper Mounts rubber cup as well with a mild soap and water solution and a soft cloth.
  • Moisten the bottom edge of the vacuum cup or the mounting surface with water. 
  • Press the Kupper Mount against the mounting surface to create seal.
  • Pump the plunger repeatedly until the Kupper Mount attaches completely. When the safety indicator band is hidden, the Kupper Mount is ready for use. 

SPECIFICATIONS 

• Total rack weight: 4 lbs
       • Rated to hold bicycles up to 45 pounds
       • Front Kupper Mount: needs only 10” of surface to be mounted
       • Rear Kupper Mount: needs only 7” of surface to be mounted
       • Operates in temperatures from 10° to 120° Fahrenheit [-12° to 49° Celsius]

 

SOME OF OUR PERFORMANCE REVIEWS:

“Other bike rack systems I looked at required complicated installation and vehicle modifications and were over $400. The Kupper Mount solved all of my problems and at only $99“ — Bob Jones. Mountain Bike Enthusiast.

“I didn't want a rack system that was permanently installed on my new car, so the Kupper Mount was the perfect solution!“ — Sally Jennings. Amateur Road Bike Racer

“A revolutionary bike transport system at an amazing price!!“ — Sean Fischer

“The perfect bike rack system for anyone on a budget, or anyone looking for a quick and easy way to mount a road or mountain bike on your car without adding costly and complicated traditional rack system.“ — Lisa Pohen

“The Kupper Mount was the perfect addition to my cycling travel gear bag. Even though I already own a complete Yakima roof rack system, I frequently grab my Kupper when I want to carry an additional bike or when traveling with a friend. I also bring it in my carry on luggage when traveling and renting a car since they rarely include bike racks“ — Robert Harris

“When I first received the Kupper Mount I was completely shocked by the build quality of this bike rack. Its constructed from the highest quality components. The front mount is the size of a big frisbee! Upon mounting it on my vehicle, I hung my body weight from it and it didn’t budge even slightly. Its very fast to install and remove. This will be invaluable when I’m traveling with rental cars since they never include a bike rack.” — Jeff Brown.

  • The Kupper Mounts are Sizzling Hot! Cuz the Best Bike Racks Have Bigger Kupps!

Risks and challenges

Kupper Mounts utilizes a manual vacuum pump that removes air from between the rubber pad and the contact surface; a red line on the pump's plunger serves as a vacuum indicator; a check valve allows the user to re-pump the cup without removing it from the contact surface; and a release mechanism allows the cup to disengage completely. 

Use the cup on clean, relatively smooth, nonporous surfaces, at temperatures from 10° to 120° Fahrenheit [-12° to 49° Celsius]. Moisture or contaminants can reduce the slip resistance of the cup. The red-line indicator may not perform reliably at elevations above 5,000 feet [1524 meters]. When traveling above 5,000 feet monitor red-line indicator at regular intervals.

Warnings: 
• Do not place the cup face against surfaces which could damage the sealing 
edges. 
• Avoid conditions that could cause the cup to slip or to disengage 
prematurely, such as: contaminants, cuts or scratches in the cup face or contact surface; applying the cup to porous materials; or applying pressure against the cup edge. 
• Do not use the cup to transport bikes when the red line is visible. If the red line reappears frequently, discontinue use and replace rubber suction cup.

This will be invaluable when I’m traveling with rental cars since they never include a bike rack.” — Jeff Brown.
