Risks and challenges
Kupper Mounts utilizes a manual vacuum pump that removes air from between the rubber pad and the contact surface; a red line on the pump's plunger serves as a vacuum indicator; a check valve allows the user to re-pump the cup without removing it from the contact surface; and a release mechanism allows the cup to disengage completely. 
Use the cup on clean, relatively smooth, nonporous surfaces, at temperatures from 10° to 120° Fahrenheit [-12° to 49° Celsius]. Moisture or contaminants can reduce the slip resistance of the cup. The red-line indicator may not perform reliably at elevations above 5,000 feet [1524 meters]. When traveling above 5,000 feet monitor red-line indicator at regular intervals.
Warnings: • Do not place the cup face against surfaces which could damage the sealing edges. • Avoid conditions that could cause the cup to slip or to disengage prematurely, such as: contaminants, cuts or scratches in the cup face or contact surface; applying the cup to porous materials; or applying pressure against the cup edge. • Do not use the cup to transport bikes when the red line is visible. If the red line reappears frequently, discontinue use and replace rubber suction cup.

story:
Short Summary

Tired of cramming into public transportation? Like the feel of fresh air on your face? Enjoy the freedom of coasting effortlessly down the street?  Prefer to spin indoors?

But, that bike seat… 

What about the rain, the sleet, the dirt, the sweat, and the thought of sharing your new outfit with the dude wearing short shorts? What about indoor cycling. Your butt hurts from sitting, you're adjusting your bike and sit down to wonder, why is someone's sweat on my LuLu Lemons? Definitely not chic.

Enter: CitySeat. A brand new cover designed for bike share programs and spin classes around the world.

Born in Brooklyn, CitySeat is a way to protect yourself and your clothing while also adding a touch of personal style. Meticulously designed by three friends—Chelsea: a fashionable but fastidious woman who loves spinning, and Colin and Hal: CitiBike-loving guys who double as design engineers with backgrounds in technical fabrics—CitySeat offers unrivaled protection from the elements in a reusable and ingenious design.

CitySeat is constructed from a proprietary blend of stretchable, waterproof fabric designed to keep you cool, clean and dry, all while contouring perfectly to the seat’s shape and rolling into itself as a 2 x 2 pouch. CitySeats are made to perfectly fit bike share programs in New York, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Boston, Chicago, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, Toronto, and Melbourne. They also fit spin bikes, and our new padded seat gives you a little extra cushion for you to tap back with comfort in style. And don’t fret, they also fit most road bikes and cruisers too! 

So no matter where life takes you, you can be confident in your ability to RIDE ON.

We're hoping to expand and begin prototyping other products that will help improve bike share programs and spin classes around the world. We need your help to really put us on the map! Since our launch in October 2014, we've been entirely self funded and most of our money has gone to prototyping, materials, and labor.

So, Fund On, friends, and leave the plastic bag seat cover at home.



What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking for $30,000 in order to refine our prototyping, source a range of fabrics, and begin producing in the kind of bulk which bike share systems demand! 
  • By having some extra material around, we'll be able to get to work sooner on refining new products and getting them to market as quickly as the requests are coming in.  
  • We'd also like to do a widespread marketing campaign. At this point, almost every major city in the United States has a bike share program and we want to make sure they're aware of what CitySeat has to offer!  While you're at it, wear a hat, tank or tee to rep us wherever you go! 

  • Although we're confident in the Indiegogo community's ability to get behind this idea, if we don't reach our goal, we'll divide the funds equally between product development, fabric sourcing, and our marketing campaign. At the end of the day, we're just a group of young people with big ideas and we need your help to make this a reality!
  • We have all new patterns that will be specially pre-released for YOU, our supporters! Be one of the first to get our new patterns so you can RIDE ON and stay dry!

  • We want you to be the first people to test our our padded bike seats! We have made a product that remains waterproof and printable, but now it's a 2.0 version with a removable pad so you can bike share to your spin class and get a little extra cush for the tush. 



The Impact

The only thing we love more than a fresh bike seat is the feeling of satisfaction we get from knowing that CitySeat is helping do more than just keep people fashionable and dry. 

BikeShares are an invaluable part of the movement to bring cities into accord with green principles! They promote healthy lifestyles, reduce our carbon footprint—and much of the time they're also more convenient! Above all, CitySeat is a tool meant to enable people take advantage of all the benefits these programs have to offer.

Not content with just the environmental impact alone, we have been and continue to donate a percentage of sales to Recycle-a-Bicycle, the New York non-profit that “fosters youth development, environmental education, community engagement, and healthy living.” 

So, the more money we're able to raise, the better our products will be, the more innovations we can roll out, and the faster we'll handle large orders! All of which, of course, is to the benefit of the environment as a whole, and charities like Recycle-a-Bicycle specifically!



Risks & Challenges

As much as we believe in the power and potential of CitySeat, we're also realistic about the challenges we face.

Thus far, one of our greatest hurdles has been the sourcing and fabrication of materials while keeping the integrity of our product fully made in America. The idea of a bike seat cover is as old as the dingy plastic bag itself, so we knew that our value had to come from superior construction and manufacture. It's why we've pushed ourselves tirelessly to work only with the best Italian fabrics, which allow us to produce beautiful products which satisfy all the functional requirements. These high standards, however, have at times made it challenging to continue to grow independently, and we're realistic about the role that proper funding will play in allowing us to heighten efficiency without compromising quality whatsoever.

We're also keenly aware of the limitations we face in spreading the word of CitySeat. The press we've generated thus far has been amazing ranging from The New York Times to Good Housekeeping, and the customer feedback is what keeps us going! But at the end of the day, we need to make sure that people know about us, and the self-funded model is simply not equipped to handle the marketing demands we face. Nothing breaks our heart more than to see someone riding around with a wet plastic bag on their seat, simply because they've never heard of us!

These challenges are real, but we're confident that with your help, we can continue to not only make the best possible products, create innovative products, but to ensure that everyone who needs a CitySeat knows where to look!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
MotoStudent is a competition promoted by the Moto Engineering Foundation. It is a tournament between Spanish, European and Worldwide university teams. The challenge is to design, develop and race prototype racing bikes, this year there will be two categories, electric (kW) and conventional  250 cc and 4T (Moto3), each with its own evaluation that will take place at a  conference held at Motorland Aragón. Participants will work in teams, competing with a limited budget and timeline to complete, over a period of three semesters, the design and prototype. The final project will be evaluated technically, economically and aesthetically. Finally, after overcoming a series of both static and dynamic tests, a race between the prototypes of the different universities will take place to do the final evaluation.

The reaped success and raised anticipation for our participation in the first and second editions of MotoStudent is driving us towards new challenges that we assume in the same spirit that so far have put: enthusiasm, motivation and work. Thanks to the collaboration of the School of Industrial Engineering and Polytechnic School, especially the professors of Mechanical Engineering, the area of ​​Fluid Mechanics and Electrical Engineering Department, we are able to use the facilities adequate (the machine shop available to the UMA in the Technological Park of Andalusia and a wind tunnel) to develop two new prototypes and set them up to race and win the fourth edition of MotoStudent. Again, two completely handmade bikes, designed and built by engineering students at the University of Málaga, will rise from paper to the competition. With the experience gained in previous editions we endorse as powerful contenders to win this competition.

We encourage you to help us achieve our goals, there will be a symbolic reward. Thanks for your cooperation.

story:
Who we are

  • We are small group of students from Cyprus University of Technology (C.U.T.) in Limassol, Cyprus. A group that got together with an aim to design and develop a new and useful mobile application for C.U.T. students who drive to campus.

  • Our project aims to provide a solution to a long term problem that has been a challenge to a great number of students. Finding a free parking space near the university facilities is a problem that students who drive to campus have to deal with every day.



What We Need & What we deliver

  • We have done all the ground work, interface design, development of ideas etc, and now we need to pay a programmer to develop the app to our specifications.

  • We will deliver an Android app for mobile phones that will help uni students get to and from their daily lectures without worrying about finding parking spaces.


The Impact

  • It is envisaged that the impact will be noticeable as the campus is all around downtown Limassol and there is currently huge pressure in finding parking. If students engage with the app, to a large extent the challenge can be addressed.


Risks & Challenges

  • The main risk we have is to raise the target amount within the limited timescale we have.

  • Testing the app within the same limited timescale is also a challenge.


Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute don't worry, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •   Share our project with your social media.
  •   Remember that a good deed a day makes your life happier!

Thank you!

story:
Designed with a large costumer base in mind, from teenagers through adults,  the bicycle distinguishes itself due to its innovative characteristics.

Carbon fiber, the majority of the bicycle is manufactured out of carbon fiber, an aerospace material ten times lighter than steel while retaining the strength equal to steel. It is manufactured as an ultralight weight bike and within the category “long lasting”, with an approximate weight of 7,5kg, making it easier to transport and store. This makes it ideal for using with public transportation or easily fitting in a vehicle’s trunk, while maintaining the agility of a modern bicycle. 

Tires, equipped with tires made of a new material that does not contain air, these tires emulate the experience of a standard tire, but they do not pop or require pumping, reinforcing the idea of zero maintenance. 

Belt, utilizes the transmission system “Gates Carbon Drive”, a serrated belt which is reinforced with carbon fiber. The belt does not require oiling or any maintenance whatsoever (since it is not a chain). It does not create stains or attaches to clothing, and is completely silent and reliable.

VCU (VIKA Central Unit), The heart of the bicycle. It houses the GPS, Bluetooth, the battery, accelerometer, and various sensors. 

Autonomous charging system, a system that charges itself and feeds the VCU. It charges as you ride your VIKA without diminishing its riding performance.

The lighting system turns on as the user enters its Bluetooth radius and turns off automatically as one walks away from it. Its sensor is also the perfect compliment to foggy days or traveling through tunnels or sudden dark paths as it turns on automatically.

The Model ZERO includes integrated LED lighting in both the front and rear. When you press the breaks on your VIKA, the accelerometer ignites the rear break light with greater intensity. The front lights utilize special optics that light up the path.

Internal cabling, the entire cabling system- brakes, transmission, and electronics- travel exclusively inside the frame preserving maximum aesthetic of design and ultimate conservation of the cables.

Foldability, a completely new system of folding that is simple, quick, and easy to maneuver. The purity of the lines in the frame are achieved thanks to a one-of-a-kind system of hidden hinges developed by VIKA. It consists of electrical contacts capable of replacing cables to transport energy, this enabling the folding to be efficient and easy.

    VIKA was created 3 years ago as a response to the lack of top gamut foldable bicycles in the market. We began working on the project by focusing on design, technology, innovative components (in order to arrive at a functional yet luxurious ride). The project was founded by Kevin Amsel and Eric Fink, Maxi Zunino joined shortly thereafter, thus creating the team behind VIKA.

    As the project developed and we continued to polish the details, we started getting closer to our objective- to achieve an ultralight weight bicycle, with purity in its design, and plenty of functionality for everyday use. The concept has always been to revolutionize the experience that each rider has with their bicycles and taking that experience to a new level. 

    We have been working since our inception with a clear objective in mind, and we maintain our principles from the first day- to guarantee that VIKA Model ZERO is the beginning of a new chapter of premium foldable bicycles.

    At Vika we believe that functionality, technology and exceptional design should be at the core of everything we do. 
    Our mission is to provide a revolutionary and unique experience to all of our customers and become market leaders in the premium foldable bicycles segment. 
    We hope to become synonymous to global personal mobility, sustainability and functional aesthetics.  

    In recent years, collective financing has revolutionized the development cycle of new products. We are confident that INDIEGOGO is the perfect medium to showcase the Model ZERO innovations and technological developments. At Vika, our main objective is to enable new experiences for all users and we believe we can make it happen with the support of the community.  

    The funds will be primarily used for the completion of the latest Model ZERO testing prototypes and mass production requirements, mobile application design and development costs as well as to create a global distribution network. 

    Place an order for a Model ZERO via INDIEGOGO and take advantage of amazing discounts. Spread the word about the project with your friends and family and you can receive a $50 discount for the purchase of a Model ZERO.

    The funds raised will be used for:

     

    • Testing functional prototypes.
    • Development of tooling. 
    • Purchase machinery & components.
    • Testing and homologation. 
    • APP development for iOS & Android.
    • Mass production.
    • Creating an international network of distributors and service stores.

    Additional funds will be used for:

     

    • Creating a line of accessories.
    • Make other colour options.
    • Improve our production processes

    • Q: Why is Model ZERO so light? Is carbon fibre a strong material?
      A: Carbon fibre is a composite material with the same strength properties than steel but at one tenth of its weight. 

      Q: Does the Model ZERO have an electric motor?
      A: No, the Model ZERO does not have an electric motor as it would go against the ultralight concept. We are planing to offer an electric motor accessory in the near future when batteries are efficient and lightweight enough. 

      Q: How does the VIKA app connect to the phone?
      A: Your VIKA app connects to your phone via bluetooth. The app will be free-of-charge and you will be able to download it through the Apple Store or Google Play in the near future.

      Q: What features will the VIKA app offer when its connected to the bike?
      A: The app will offer GPS theft security and fitness tracking. 

      Q: Can I ride the bike without a smartphone?
      A: Yes, you can. After your ride, you can connect the app to the bike and it will synchronize the data from your latest trip in order to give you detailed fitness tracking information. 

      Q: Can I buy bike accessories for the Model ZERO?
      A: Yes, we have a number of accessories planned for the near future. Stay tuned to learn about them. 

      Q: What is the maximum recommended rider weight?
      A: We recommend that the rider’s weight should be under 110kg or 220lbs (including luggage). We are working towards increasing the weight limit in the near future. 

      Q: What s the maximum recommended rider height?
      A: We recommend that the rider’s heights should be under 1,90m or 6ft. 

      Q: Doest Model ZERO come in different sizes? 
      A: The Model ZERO is designed to fit all. The seat height and handle can be adjusted according to your needs. You won’t have any problem to ride it if you are 1,40m or 1,90m tall.  

      Q: Can I still ride the bike if the battery runs out of power? How do I charge the battery?
      A: Yes you can and if you do so the battery charges as you ride the bike. The battery charges when the wheels turn on, so the battery will be charging even if you are riding downhill but you are not pedalling.

      Q: How much does shipping cost?
      A: Shipping is  between $100 to $300 USD (depending on your destination) due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our factory in Argentina. You will receive a shipping confirmation and estimate once an order is placed. 

      Q: What kind of warranty do you offer?  
      A: All VIKA bikes come with a 2 year manufacturer's warranty for the frame and fork. Due to the regular wear and tear of many elements of a bike, we do not offer warranty on parts such as tires, brakes, belt, etc.

      Q: What about spare parts? Can any bike shop assist me?
      A: The Model ZERO has a custom frame and internal components such as hinges and electronics that can only be bought from our factory and our trusted distributors network. The rest of the components are standard and can be fixed by any bike shop. 

      Q: Who is responsible to pay for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST?
      A: The backer is responsible for all corresponding taxes. Please check your country's import duties/VAT/GST before purchasing.

      Q: Can I choose the colour of the bike?
      A: There are 2 colour combinations to choose from:
      Pure: White with black details or All Black: Black with Black details.

      Q: How is Model ZERO unique from other folding bicycles? 
      A: Because of its integrated hidden hinges and internal cables, Model ZERO offers a unique design and the lightest weight of all the existing folding bicycles. It features GPS navigation, fitness tracking and no maintenance needs. 

      Q: Is the CVT (Continuously Variable Transmission) automatic or manual?
      A: The CVT is a manual transmission. 

      Q: Where is the battery located? Can the battery be removed?
      A: The battery is located inside the frame and due to security and correct installation it can only can be removed by our shop services.

    • For the last three years, we have dedicated 100% of our collective experience to the development of Model ZERO.  
      We have partnered with incredible strategic partners and are proud to offer the most innovative bicycle components to create a truly outstanding product for ours customers. We are confident that out approach will greatly minimize development risks and ultimately deliver on our promises to all of our backers. We are aware that the biggest challenge is to create an adequate mass production plan and are already working hard towards achieving that goal. 

      We are still developing Model ZERO and we believe that communication with our backers is the most important element of our campaign, therefore you will be the first to know about all the news and milestones that we will reach.
story_txt:
Designed with a large costumer base in mind, from teenagers through adults,  the bicycle distinguishes itself due to its innovative characteristics.

Carbon fiber, the majority of the bicycle is manufactured out of carbon fiber, an aerospace material ten times lighter than steel while retaining the strength equal to steel. It is manufactured as an ultralight weight bike and within the category “long lasting”, with an approximate weight of 7,5kg, making it easier to transport and store. This makes it ideal for using with public transportation or easily fitting in a vehicle’s trunk, while maintaining the agility of a modern bicycle. 

Tires, equipped with tires made of a new material that does not contain air, these tires emulate the experience of a standard tire, but they do not pop or require pumping, reinforcing the idea of zero maintenance. 

Belt, utilizes the transmission system “Gates Carbon Drive”, a serrated belt which is reinforced with carbon fiber. The belt does not require oiling or any maintenance whatsoever (since it is not a chain). It does not create stains or attaches to clothing, and is completely silent and reliable.


VCU (VIKA Central Unit), The heart of the bicycle. It houses the GPS, Bluetooth, the battery, accelerometer, and various sensors. 

Autonomous charging system, a system that charges itself and feeds the VCU. It charges as you ride your VIKA without diminishing its riding performance.

The lighting system turns on as the user enters its Bluetooth radius and turns off automatically as one walks away from it. Its sensor is also the perfect compliment to foggy days or traveling through tunnels or sudden dark paths as it turns on automatically.

The Model ZERO includes integrated LED lighting in both the front and rear. When you press the breaks on your VIKA, the accelerometer ignites the rear break light with greater intensity. The front lights utilize special optics that light up the path.

Internal cabling, the entire cabling system- brakes, transmission, and electronics- travel exclusively inside the frame preserving maximum aesthetic of design and ultimate conservation of the cables.

Foldability, a completely new system of folding that is simple, quick, and easy to maneuver. The purity of the lines in the frame are achieved thanks to a one-of-a-kind system of hidden hinges developed by VIKA. It consists of electrical contacts capable of replacing cables to transport energy, this enabling the folding to be efficient and easy.


























VIKA was created 3 years ago as a response to the lack of top gamut foldable bicycles in the market. We began working on the project by focusing on design, technology, innovative components (in order to arrive at a functional yet luxurious ride). The project was founded by Kevin Amsel and Eric Fink, Maxi Zunino joined shortly thereafter, thus creating the team behind VIKA.As the project developed and we continued to polish the details, we started getting closer to our objective- to achieve an ultralight weight bicycle, with purity in its design, and plenty of functionality for everyday use. The concept has always been to revolutionize the experience that each rider has with their bicycles and taking that experience to a new level. We have been working since our inception with a clear objective in mind, and we maintain our principles from the first day- to guarantee that VIKA Model ZERO is the beginning of a new chapter of premium foldable bicycles.At Vika we believe that functionality, technology and exceptional design should be at the core of everything we do. Our mission is to provide a revolutionary and unique experience to all of our customers and become market leaders in the premium foldable bicycles segment. We hope to become synonymous to global personal mobility, sustainability and functional aesthetics.  In recent years, collective financing has revolutionized the development cycle of new products. We are confident that INDIEGOGO is the perfect medium to showcase the Model ZERO innovations and technological developments. At Vika, our main objective is to enable new experiences for all users and we believe we can make it happen with the support of the community.  The funds will be primarily used for the completion of the latest Model ZERO testing prototypes and mass production requirements, mobile application design and development costs as well as to create a global distribution network. Place an order for a Model ZERO via INDIEGOGO and take advantage of amazing discounts. Spread the word about the project with your friends and family and you can receive a $50 discount for the purchase of a Model ZERO.The funds raised will be used for: 
Testing functional prototypes.
Development of tooling. 
Purchase machinery & components.
Testing and homologation. 
APP development for iOS & Android.
Mass production.
Creating an international network of distributors and service stores.
Additional funds will be used for: 
Creating a line of accessories.
Make other colour options.
Improve our production processes






Q: Why is Model ZERO so light? Is carbon fibre a strong material?A: Carbon fibre is a composite material with the same strength properties than steel but at one tenth of its weight. 
Q: Does the Model ZERO have an electric motor?A: No, the Model ZERO does not have an electric motor as it would go against the ultralight concept. We are planing to offer an electric motor accessory in the near future when batteries are efficient and lightweight enough. 
Q: How does the VIKA app connect to the phone?A: Your VIKA app connects to your phone via bluetooth. The app will be free-of-charge and you will be able to download it through the Apple Store or Google Play in the near future.
Q: What features will the VIKA app offer when its connected to the bike?A: The app will offer GPS theft security and fitness tracking. 
Q: Can I ride the bike without a smartphone?A: Yes, you can. After your ride, you can connect the app to the bike and it will synchronize the data from your latest trip in order to give you detailed fitness tracking information. 
Q: Can I buy bike accessories for the Model ZERO?A: Yes, we have a number of accessories planned for the near future. Stay tuned to learn about them. 
Q: What is the maximum recommended rider weight?A: We recommend that the rider’s weight should be under 110kg or 220lbs (including luggage). We are working towards increasing the weight limit in the near future. 
Q: What s the maximum recommended rider height?A: We recommend that the rider’s heights should be under 1,90m or 6ft. 
Q: Doest Model ZERO come in different sizes? A: The Model ZERO is designed to fit all. The seat height and handle can be adjusted according to your needs. You won’t have any problem to ride it if you are 1,40m or 1,90m tall.  
Q: Can I still ride the bike if the battery runs out of power? How do I charge the battery?A: Yes you can and if you do so the battery charges as you ride the bike. The battery charges when the wheels turn on, so the battery will be charging even if you are riding downhill but you are not pedalling.
Q: How much does shipping cost?A: Shipping is  between $100 to $300 USD (depending on your destination) due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our factory in Argentina. You will receive a shipping confirmation and estimate once an order is placed. 
Q: What kind of warranty do you offer?  A: All VIKA bikes come with a 2 year manufacturer's warranty for the frame and fork. Due to the regular wear and tear of many elements of a bike, we do not offer warranty on parts such as tires, brakes, belt, etc.
Q: What about spare parts? Can any bike shop assist me?A: The Model ZERO has a custom frame and internal components such as hinges and electronics that can only be bought from our factory and our trusted distributors network. The rest of the components are standard and can be fixed by any bike shop. 
Q: Who is responsible to pay for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST?A: The backer is responsible for all corresponding taxes. Please check your country's import duties/VAT/GST before purchasing.
Q: Can I choose the colour of the bike?A: There are 2 colour combinations to choose from:Pure: White with black details or All Black: Black with Black details.
Q: How is Model ZERO unique from other folding bicycles? A: Because of its integrated hidden hinges and internal cables, Model ZERO offers a unique design and the lightest weight of all the existing folding bicycles. It features GPS navigation, fitness tracking and no maintenance needs. 
Q: Is the CVT (Continuously Variable Transmission) automatic or manual?A: The CVT is a manual transmission. 
Q: Where is the battery located? Can the battery be removed?A: The battery is located inside the frame and due to security and correct installation it can only can be removed by our shop services.


For the last three years, we have dedicated 100% of our collective experience to the development of Model ZERO.  We have partnered with incredible strategic partners and are proud to offer the most innovative bicycle components to create a truly outstanding product for ours customers. We are confident that out approach will greatly minimize development risks and ultimately deliver on our promises to all of our backers. We are aware that the biggest challenge is to create an adequate mass production plan and are already working hard towards achieving that goal. 
We are still developing Model ZERO and we believe that communication with our backers is the most important element of our campaign, therefore you will be the first to know about all the news and milestones that we will reach.

story:
Summary

StickieBalls are vehicle mounting kits for mobile devices that can be used with any mobile phone, tablet, GPS, Kindle or other mobile device. The StickieBalls  mission is to provide a safe, effective and inexpensive way for drivers to secure their phones and other devices while driving, yet still give hands-free access for receiving calls.

SmartWeb Mobile hopes to use the IndieGoGo campaign to increase awareness of the texting-while-driving epidemic. It's a worldwide problem, but here are the sad statistics for American drivers:

TEXTING WHILE DRIVING CAUSES…

> 1,600,000 accidents per year – National Safety Council
> 330,000 injuries per year – Harvard Center for Risk Analysis Study
> 11 teen deaths EVERY DAY – Insurance Institute for Highway Safety Fatality Facts
> Nearly 25% of ALL car accidents. That’s ONE in FOUR!

Together we can help prevent texting-while-driving accidents by providing a simple solution that nearly any driver can afford.

My Own Experience

This may have happened to you also. When driving recently I was forced to slam on my brakes and swerve to avoid a careless texting driver who had drifted into my lane. As a result of that screeching near-miss my mobile phone, which was lying loose on the center console, was launched into the dash and ended up in the floorboard. Not good. So I went about finding a better way to secure my phone in the car and still have it within reach if needed.

  • Introducing StickieBalls. 
  • Keeps you AND your phone safer while driving.
  • Help us reduce the number of phone-related traffic collisions.

Please, please, please don’t text and drive!

It’s not just about texting while driving. It’s also about having a loose cell phone sliding around on the seat or the dashboard, distracting the driver and causing an unsafe situation. StickieBalls are a simple, inexpensive fix to avoid a lot of vehicle crashes and needless highway carnage. We hope drivers will support our IndieGoGo campaign and learn how they can help make our roadways safer for everyone.


For our Supporters:
StickieBalls are precision engineered for durability. In our testing, the first thing users noticed when they opened the box was just how heavy the StickieBall was. The chrome plated ball housed in its plastic pedestal is over an inch in diameter and is forged of solid steel. The magnetic rotating disk is precision machined out of a solid block of stainless steel and is encased in hardened plastic.

The StickieBall pedestal is firmly anchored to the vehicle by industrial strength 3M Brand tape. The StickieBall Universal Safety Kit comes with two metal disks for the back of your devices so you can attach either of two different devices to the magnetic base. It also comes with an additional 3M tape disk and a handy alcohol-wipe to clean the surface before you attach the base to the surface and the disk(s) to the device(s). Additional metal disks are available in a StickieBall Spare Parts Kit.


Focus groups were consulted to test the merits of StickieBalls. Several ideas and suggestions came from that testing, such as using StickieBalls on the side of a cabinet in the kitchen; affixing StickieBalls to the side of computer monitors, placing a ‘Kindle’ out of reach of little ones but still allowing video viewing; adding a video screen to the rear seats of the family SUV; attaching a phone to a wheelchair or other mobility device; attaching a TV remote. You will undoubtedly find more uses for StickieBalls. We'd love to hear your suggestions!


What We Need & What You Get

The funding will be used for initial parts inventory, assembly, product packaging and social media campaigns. These campaigns will draw attention to the issue and raise awareness of what is becoming an epidemic among younger drivers.

  • Our supporters will have a variety of Perks available to them.
  • Early Bird Supporters who pledge their support prior to October 15, 2015 will receive a complete StickieBalls Universal Safety Kit at a $5 Discount from the Retail price after the Campaign ends.
  • Recognizing that many people will find multiple uses for StickieBalls, we have created a 2-Pak, a 5-Pak and a 10-Pak of StickieBalls Kits, all at discounted prices on IndieGoGo. You can review all of your Perks right on this page.

Risks & Challenges

StickieBalls are here in limited quantities right now. Our IndieGoGo Campaign will provide the needed capital to expand production to meet the forecasted demand. With the Holidays just around the corner we believe our supporters will want to make gifts of StickieBalls to family members,  loved ones and others they care about. Our funding goals are very modest. We have enough inventory to meet all orders up to our goal,  so there is no financial risk to early supporters if our goal is not reached. You WILL receive your StickieBalls.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a pledge right now?  No problem! Maybe you can help spread the word and take StickieBalls viral! Visit our website at StickieBalls.com and share on Facebook, Twitter, InstaGram and Pinterest.

story:
THE J.IN.K.E.R. PROJECT 
WELCOME - YOU CAN HELP US FLY

With your support we can build our first flying Jinker. 

What was once a dream is now a part-complete flying wing prototype, designed to take flight under human power and deliver a remarkably efficient form of flight. An original idea of Niko Pietrek who drew his inspiration from birds and experiments with zeppelins among others will become reality. Wings can serve to translate both lift and fall of the pilot´s body acceleration into travelling motion.

We will use your support to finish our first full scale competition ready flying wing.
The team has thus far built the first Jinker wing and now requires support to perform the inevitable tests and trimming for safety reasons. We will be conducting several experimental tests and first flights with a pilot throughout the following months. 

By purchasing our perks you will be helping us complete the Jinker, and primarily with the following : 

  • Transport to the flying field for testing and flight trials
  • Pilot training 
  • Composite Carbon Fiber for the cockpit, rudders and tail

If we oversubscribe we will use the additional funds to begin building a second Jinker and to begin our preperations for the world record and Kremer Prize Sports. 

 

 

THE JINKER PERKS

We have put together a comprehensive range of perks, which allow us to return something back and to say thank you for your generous support. Our merchandise is made from high quality materials and wherever possible responsibly sourced from sustainable sources. We hope that you will help us raise awareness by posting our fund page on social media. 


 

THE CORE JINKER TEAM 


     

THE JINKER WING & CONSTRUCTION

The Jinker wing is a light portable flight apparatus with a semi-round fuselage, a flexible frame and downwards-curved fixed wings. The wings are pre-loaded such that they are horizontal in level flight and provide the necessary rebound effect in flapping motion. 
The general construction is carbon fibre spars and booms with a flexible yet aerodynamic wing covering. This is required to achieve the correct torsional strength while allowing for a very dynamic wing surface flex both on top and bottom. 

JINKER FLYING WING PRINCIPLE

The Jinker ornithopter is started against the wind from an elevated place like a ramp or a hill. The pilot runs towards the wind until the ornithopter is carried by the airflow. He then jumps from behind onto the frame, which is open in the rear and he starts to glide first.

After that, the pilot initiates the flapping of the wings by gently jumping on the plane and slowly and rhythmically increasing the body acceleration and frequency.

The image below illustrates the flapping and flying motion. 

HISTORY OF FLYING FLAPPING WINGS

For hundreds of years man has tried to produce a flying wing that is capable of flight similar to that of a bird. 

Records of designs have come from all regions of the world and all sorts of cultures but most notably from the following: 

1500 Leonardo DaVinci. The Italian genius and visionary designed a Flapping Wing Machine which he called “Ornithopter”. This word creation has been established as official nomenclature for a Flying Machine with Flapping Wings within the community.

1789 Asato Shiushio. This aeronautical pioneer was highly honored by the local emperor of Okinawa Island for his successful flight with his flapping wing construction made of bamboo and textile featherwork.

1894 Otto Lilienthal. The modern aeronautical pioneer built and tested several prototypes with flapping wing technology. Unfortunately he died during one of the flight attempts.

1942 Adalbert Schmid. He built and successfully tested a motorized ornithopter, which was featured with one fixed wing for continuous lift generation and with one pair of flapping wings for propulsion.

2010 Todd Reichert. The enormous effort of Todd Reichert and his Canadian Team culminated in the attempt to perform and document the first successful sustained flight with a human powered ornithopter! For the first time in history a human powered ornithopter could maintain the initial flight altitude for the duration of 19,3sec! He and his “Snowbird” are the actual world record holders!

JINKER FEASIBILITY STUDY  

A highly detailed and lengthy feasibility study was conducted by the well-respected Professor  Dipl.-Ing. R. Voit–Nitschmann from IFB in Stuttgart, Germany, who concluded in his report that the concept of a flying wing with a human being as an energy source is not just feasible but indeed able to fullfill a sustained and climbing flight, provided the prescribed means of jumping is used to induce a rebound effect on the wings and thus forward air speed.
Quote: “For a flight with about 2m/s climb speed and assumed 100% pilot efficiency 46km/h average airspeed is required for a Jinker with 15m spanwidth.”               

The full feasibility study can be downloaded here:
 
www.jinker.de/documents/feasability/JINKER-Proo... 


Prof. Dipl.-Ing. R. Voit–Nitschmann
SFL GmbH 
Baumwiesenweg 6b
70569 Stuttgart
Germany

JINKER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

The Jinker is a patented design, based on the originality of the wing shape form and function and the ability of the pilot to induce flapping of the wings causing forward speed and thus in turn lift. 

The full patent can be downloaded or viewed from the links below and we welcome any thoughts or feedback. 

An English version of the patent can be made available upon request.


The Jinker has a multi-region patent and can be viewed here:
www.jinker.de/documents/patent/WO002009074349A2...

The Jinker has a multi-region patent and can be downloaded here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AHpnWFHp_W8 

RISKS & TECHNICAL CHALLENGES

  • Engineering

The complexity of designing a fixed and flexible wing is compounded by the fact that the Jinker wing needs to keep the shape of the profiles while flapping. 

  • Piloting 

The pilots will need to become well suited to the Jinker energy motion output likely requiring specialist training. The fact that the pilot is much heavier than the Jinker will require a change of mind set, meaning that he is not a passenger, but that he carries the Jinker with him!

  • Materials 

While carbon fibre is the primary material we feel that more work still needs to be done on the preformed sections and in experimenting with new and lighter weight composites such as graphene.

  • Construction 

Construction is challenging, and requires some skill which we feel well adapted to, however the final most efficient form will require some refinement over time, based on the testing experience.

OUR PLANNED ACHIEVEMENTS 

  1. Complete the theoritcal CFD analysis of the wing shape and design of the cockpit and tail - April 2017 
  2. Build the first fully operational prototype. March - May 2017  
  3. Complete several rounds of testing, proving the Jinker is safe and capable of human powered flight. May-July 2017 
  4. Complete several rounds of human powered flight recording precisely all data for performance enhacement analysis. July 2017 
  5. Complete several stage objectives such as 25 second flight and a distance flight of over 1km. July - August 2017 
  6. Complete the World Record attempt validating the Jinker as a Human powered Ornithopter. July - August 2017 
  7. Complete several further distance flights to achieve maximum pilot output. August - September 2017
  8. Complete the Kremer Prize Sport distance target of 3km in a single flight. September - October 2017
  9. Analyse all data and eventually make final adjustments to the wing. 
  10. Compete in and win the Kremer Prize Sports, and in so doing the beggining of a new World sport. October 2017 
  11. Establish a mechanism for training, development and further growth of the sport.

Disclaimer:
All dates are planned according to expected build and trial progress along with external factors such as weather and the event organisers timeline.

FURTHER SUPPORT US BY:

  • Please spread the word, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, anything you can think of would be helpful. The more people we have supporting us the better, as we want to build a community movement for what could be a new sport. 
  • Please sign up to our newsletter and stay updated on our progress by opting in to our email updates.
  • Giving us your feedback and any suggestions are welcome.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

 

1: Will I have to jump all the time?

No, basically the Jinker is a glider, for safety reasons. Only if the pilot needs to accelerate or to gain altitude he/she needs to jump. Most probably in real life the flapping phases will be much shorter than the gliding phases, except you are participating in a sports competition whose winner is the fastest on a defined track.

2: How will the Jinker be maneuvered?

Both by moving the body into any desired direction and thus changing the center of gravity like you see it with delta wings, and also with the help of small ailerons on the tip of the wings and the rear pitch elevator

3: How fast will the Jinker fly?

This is difficult to predict, but basically we expect flight speeds between 40Km/h and 60Km/h, depending on each singular flight situation. All in all the Jinker will not be very fast.

4: Is the Jinker safe?

Yes, safety has been one main aspect throughout the development of the Jinker. The concept provides that at any convenient time point the pilot can stop all jumping and maneuvering and then the Jinker will be a regular glider. This is possible because the wings are fixed to the cockpit and no hinges or other moving parts are involved. Additionally the pilot will always wear a parachute.

5: Have you proved the concept with a scale model?

             No, for three reasons.

  A: The effort to build a model was considered to be as high as the effort to build a    1:1 Jinker prototype.

  B: How can we tailor the model to react to turbulences? We cannot. All we can do is teach   the model to fly under very specific and limited conditions.

C: This means that we cannot learn anything from a model, but that we have to teach the model to do something that we really do not fully understand yet. Don´t forget that nobody has ever done something like this before!

Most importantly though is the fact that a pilot can feel the actions and reactions of the Jinker and he will be able to use all his senses to deal with it. A pilot will use his intuitive and anticipative skills to fly the Jinker according to the individual situation and report about it. So we will be able to learn from the pilot and improve the Jinker much more efficiently until we reach a flight quality level which is predictable and repeatable.

6: Can I buy a Jinker?

In the future yes, but you have to understand that for safety reasons there have to be organized structures available like in any popular sports. Most probably you will become a member in a Jinker club, association or academy and go through a series of training sessions. We plan to build a 2 persons Jinker for the purpose of training. This will be important in order to have safe conditions, a high level of technical quality, predictable conditions and lots of shared experiences in the Jinker community all around the world.

7: How expensive will a Jinker be?

As you can see, the Jinker is a very simple construction with only a few basic parts which are not so complicated to build once the final design is in place and you have repeatable processes. We cannot state any precise figure right now, but for sure it will be affordable for any average person. It is a bit early to mention this but part of our concept provides that in future real life you may only have to buy specific parts of the Jinker that match to your individual weight/size ratio, like the fuselage of the wings.

8: How does the Jinker take off?

To take off with the Jniker will be as easy as taking off with a paraglider or a delta wing. It will be carried to a ramp or hill, from which the pilot will jump. After a gliding phase to gain speed, the pilot will gently start to jump in order to induce the flapping of the wings. It will also be possible to let the Jinker be towed up to speed like a regular glider.

9: What about the landing?

It was extremely important to design and build the Jinker as light as possible. Therefore all parts have a double function and no heavy landing wheels are incorporated. The base on which the pilot stands will be shaped like a surf board and serve as landing means. Because the nose of the Jinker has to look upwards during the landing phase, the tail of the Jinker must be placed quite high in order to not interfere.

10: Can anyone fly a Jinker?

Basically yes. It will be necessary though to be trained and to eventually get a sort of license. This is due to safety and regulatory standards to be accomplished. Don´t forget that as a Jinker pilot you will be participating on air traffic! The authorities make a big difference between active and passive airplanes, the Jinker being an active one. Depending on the purpose of your envolvement in a Jinker academy or club, the training will most probably even incorporate lessons for meteorology and radio transmission in order to capacitate you to reach whatever location and/or flight duration safely.

11: Is there a weight limit for a Jinker pilot?

Not as long as you are healthy and fit. It will be important though to have a Jinker suitable to your individual weight. The Jinker for a heavy pilot will therefore be slightly larger than for a light one in terms of wing surface. There will also be different Jinker configurations available depending on the type of flight you want to perform like endurance or racing. For an endurance flight the wings will most probably be longer and slimmer, and so forth. These are all things we have to find out while we bring the Jinker to perfection and collect experience.

12: How high can I fly with a Jinker?

Good question! I can´t really know this yet, but I cannot think of a good reason why you should not be able to fly as high as a paraglider under the same conditions. The only prediction I can make is that after a comparable start you will be able to climb and/or maintain the initial altitude as long as you are fit enough to jump! In many cases the Jinker will carry you to reach an up wind, when a paraglider may fail due to the lack of altitude!

 

13: Will there be different Jinker models available?

Yes. We are for example planning a Jinker for two persons as a future training platform. For the time being our first aim has to be to bring the actual version to a point where we can perform predictable and safe flights. At the time we reach the public we will need to offer different Jinker configurations to suit each individual pilot´s physical condition in terms of weight, size and fitness. There will also be different configurations available for racing competitions, endurance competitions, enjoyable cruising flights, etc.. The more experience we gain, the better we will be able to fulfill the different expectations.

 

14: When will the Jinker be available to the public?

You have to consider that we are introducing a completely new and revolutionary flying apparatus. Our first aim is to set a new world record and subsequently win the Kremer Prize Sports. The latter is an unconditional step towards making the Jinker popular. We are totally committed to accomplish both aims within this year. The rest of the path depends on our level of success and the level of support we get, both from the public and the authorities. It is predictable though that we will have to work hard to achieve a public availability for the next couple of years…

THE J.IN.K.E.R. PROJECT WELCOME - YOU CAN HELP US FLYWith your support we can build our first flying Jinker. What was once a dream is now a part-complete flying wing prototype, designed to take flight under human power and deliver a remarkably efficient form of flight. An original idea of Niko Pietrek who drew his inspiration from birds and experiments with zeppelins among others will become reality. Wings can serve to translate both lift and fall of the pilot´s body acceleration into travelling motion.We will use your support to finish our first full scale competition ready flying wing.The team has thus far built the first Jinker wing and now requires support to perform the inevitable tests and trimming for safety reasons. We will be conducting several experimental tests and first flights with a pilot throughout the following months. By purchasing our perks you will be helping us complete the Jinker, and primarily with the following : 
Transport to the flying field for testing and flight trials
Pilot training 
Composite Carbon Fiber for the cockpit, rudders and tail
If we oversubscribe we will use the additional funds to begin building a second Jinker and to begin our preperations for the world record and Kremer Prize Sports.   THE JINKER PERKSWe have put together a comprehensive range of perks, which allow us to return something back and to say thank you for your generous support. Our merchandise is made from high quality materials and wherever possible responsibly sourced from sustainable sources. We hope that you will help us raise awareness by posting our fund page on social media.  THE CORE JINKER TEAM      THE JINKER WING & CONSTRUCTIONThe Jinker wing is a light portable flight apparatus with a semi-round fuselage, a flexible frame and downwards-curved fixed wings. The wings are pre-loaded such that they are horizontal in level flight and provide the necessary rebound effect in flapping motion. The general construction is carbon fibre spars and booms with a flexible yet aerodynamic wing covering. This is required to achieve the correct torsional strength while allowing for a very dynamic wing surface flex both on top and bottom. JINKER FLYING WING PRINCIPLEThe Jinker ornithopter is started against the wind from an elevated place like a ramp or a hill. The pilot runs towards the wind until the ornithopter is carried by the airflow. He then jumps from behind onto the frame, which is open in the rear and he starts to glide first.After that, the pilot initiates the flapping of the wings by gently jumping on the plane and slowly and rhythmically increasing the body acceleration and frequency.The image below illustrates the flapping and flying motion. HISTORY OF FLYING FLAPPING WINGSFor hundreds of years man has tried to produce a flying wing that is capable of flight similar to that of a bird. Records of designs have come from all regions of the world and all sorts of cultures but most notably from the following: 1500 Leonardo DaVinci. The Italian genius and visionary designed a Flapping Wing Machine which he called “Ornithopter”. This word creation has been established as official nomenclature for a Flying Machine with Flapping Wings within the community.1789 Asato Shiushio. This aeronautical pioneer was highly honored by the local emperor of Okinawa Island for his successful flight with his flapping wing construction made of bamboo and textile featherwork.1894 Otto Lilienthal. The modern aeronautical pioneer built and tested several prototypes with flapping wing technology. Unfortunately he died during one of the flight attempts.1942 Adalbert Schmid. He built and successfully tested a motorized ornithopter, which was featured with one fixed wing for continuous lift generation and with one pair of flapping wings for propulsion.2010 Todd Reichert. The enormous effort of Todd Reichert and his Canadian Team culminated in the attempt to perform and document the first successful sustained flight with a human powered ornithopter! For the first time in history a human powered ornithopter could maintain the initial flight altitude for the duration of 19,3sec! He and his “Snowbird” are the actual world record holders!JINKER FEASIBILITY STUDY  A highly detailed and lengthy feasibility study was conducted by the well-respected Professor  Dipl.-Ing. R. Voit–Nitschmann from IFB in Stuttgart, Germany, who concluded in his report that the concept of a flying wing with a human being as an energy source is not just feasible but indeed able to fullfill a sustained and climbing flight, provided the prescribed means of jumping is used to induce a rebound effect on the wings and thus forward air speed.Quote: “For a flight with about 2m/s climb speed and assumed 100% pilot efficiency 46km/h average airspeed is required for a Jinker with 15m spanwidth.”                The full feasibility study can be downloaded here: www.jinker.de/documents/feasability/JINKER-Proo... Prof. Dipl.-Ing. R. Voit–NitschmannSFL GmbH Baumwiesenweg 6b70569 StuttgartGermanyJINKER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTYThe Jinker is a patented design, based on the originality of the wing shape form and function and the ability of the pilot to induce flapping of the wings causing forward speed and thus in turn lift. The full patent can be downloaded or viewed from the links below and we welcome any thoughts or feedback. An English version of the patent can be made available upon request.The Jinker has a multi-region patent and can be viewed here:www.jinker.de/documents/patent/WO002009074349A2...The Jinker has a multi-region patent and can be downloaded here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AHpnWFHp_W8 RISKS & TECHNICAL CHALLENGESEngineeringThe complexity of designing a fixed and flexible wing is compounded by the fact that the Jinker wing needs to keep the shape of the profiles while flapping. Piloting The pilots will need to become well suited to the Jinker energy motion output likely requiring specialist training. The fact that the pilot is much heavier than the Jinker will require a change of mind set, meaning that he is not a passenger, but that he carries the Jinker with him!Materials While carbon fibre is the primary material we feel that more work still needs to be done on the preformed sections and in experimenting with new and lighter weight composites such as graphene.Construction Construction is challenging, and requires some skill which we feel well adapted to, however the final most efficient form will require some refinement over time, based on the testing experience.OUR PLANNED ACHIEVEMENTS 
Complete the theoritcal CFD analysis of the wing shape and design of the cockpit and tail - April 2017 
Build the first fully operational prototype. March - May 2017  
Complete several rounds of testing, proving the Jinker is safe and capable of human powered flight. May-July 2017 
Complete several rounds of human powered flight recording precisely all data for performance enhacement analysis. July 2017 
Complete several stage objectives such as 25 second flight and a distance flight of over 1km. July - August 2017 

Complete the World Record attempt validating the Jinker as a Human powered Ornithopter. July - August 2017 
Complete several further distance flights to achieve maximum pilot output. August - September 2017

Complete the Kremer Prize Sport distance target of 3km in a single flight. September - October 2017

Analyse all data and eventually make final adjustments to the wing. 

Compete in and win the Kremer Prize Sports, and in so doing the beggining of a new World sport. October 2017 

Establish a mechanism for training, development and further growth of the sport.
Disclaimer:All dates are planned according to expected build and trial progress along with external factors such as weather and the event organisers timeline.FURTHER SUPPORT US BY:
Please spread the word, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, anything you can think of would be helpful. The more people we have supporting us the better, as we want to build a community movement for what could be a new sport. 
Please sign up to our newsletter and stay updated on our progress by opting in to our email updates.
Giving us your feedback and any suggestions are welcome.
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1: Will I have to jump all the time?No, basically the Jinker is a glider, for safety reasons. Only if the pilot needs to accelerate or to gain altitude he/she needs to jump. Most probably in real life the flapping phases will be much shorter than the gliding phases, except you are participating in a sports competition whose winner is the fastest on a defined track.2: How will the Jinker be maneuvered?Both by moving the body into any desired direction and thus changing the center of gravity like you see it with delta wings, and also with the help of small ailerons on the tip of the wings and the rear pitch elevator3: How fast will the Jinker fly?This is difficult to predict, but basically we expect flight speeds between 40Km/h and 60Km/h, depending on each singular flight situation. All in all the Jinker will not be very fast.4: Is the Jinker safe?Yes, safety has been one main aspect throughout the development of the Jinker. The concept provides that at any convenient time point the pilot can stop all jumping and maneuvering and then the Jinker will be a regular glider. This is possible because the wings are fixed to the cockpit and no hinges or other moving parts are involved. Additionally the pilot will always wear a parachute.5: Have you proved the concept with a scale model?             No, for three reasons.  A: The effort to build a model was considered to be as high as the effort to build a    1:1 Jinker prototype.  B: How can we tailor the model to react to turbulences? We cannot. All we can do is teach   the model to fly under very specific and limited conditions.C: This means that we cannot learn anything from a model, but that we have to teach the model to do something that we really do not fully understand yet. Don´t forget that nobody has ever done something like this before!Most importantly though is the fact that a pilot can feel the actions and reactions of the Jinker and he will be able to use all his senses to deal with it. A pilot will use his intuitive and anticipative skills to fly the Jinker according to the individual situation and report about it. So we will be able to learn from the pilot and improve the Jinker much more efficiently until we reach a flight quality level which is predictable and repeatable.6: Can I buy a Jinker?In the future yes, but you have to understand that for safety reasons there have to be organized structures available like in any popular sports. Most probably you will become a member in a Jinker club, association or academy and go through a series of training sessions. We plan to build a 2 persons Jinker for the purpose of training. This will be important in order to have safe conditions, a high level of technical quality, predictable conditions and lots of shared experiences in the Jinker community all around the world.7: How expensive will a Jinker be?As you can see, the Jinker is a very simple construction with only a few basic parts which are not so complicated to build once the final design is in place and you have repeatable processes. We cannot state any precise figure right now, but for sure it will be affordable for any average person. It is a bit early to mention this but part of our concept provides that in future real life you may only have to buy specific parts of the Jinker that match to your individual weight/size ratio, like the fuselage of the wings.8: How does the Jinker take off?To take off with the Jniker will be as easy as taking off with a paraglider or a delta wing. It will be carried to a ramp or hill, from which the pilot will jump. After a gliding phase to gain speed, the pilot will gently start to jump in order to induce the flapping of the wings. It will also be possible to let the Jinker be towed up to speed like a regular glider.9: What about the landing?It was extremely important to design and build the Jinker as light as possible. Therefore all parts have a double function and no heavy landing wheels are incorporated. The base on which the pilot stands will be shaped like a surf board and serve as landing means. Because the nose of the Jinker has to look upwards during the landing phase, the tail of the Jinker must be placed quite high in order to not interfere.10: Can anyone fly a Jinker?Basically yes. It will be necessary though to be trained and to eventually get a sort of license. This is due to safety and regulatory standards to be accomplished. Don´t forget that as a Jinker pilot you will be participating on air traffic! The authorities make a big difference between active and passive airplanes, the Jinker being an active one. Depending on the purpose of your envolvement in a Jinker academy or club, the training will most probably even incorporate lessons for meteorology and radio transmission in order to capacitate you to reach whatever location and/or flight duration safely.11: Is there a weight limit for a Jinker pilot?Not as long as you are healthy and fit. The more experience we gain, the better we will be able to fulfill the different expectations. 14: When will the Jinker be available to the public?You have to consider that we are introducing a completely new and revolutionary flying apparatus. story:
It’s the first modular skateboard power device.

Easy to Install / Remove.

FUNING-BOARD kit can convert most longboards, skateboards to an electric one in seconds (Except Drop through longboards and bear trucks, but we’ll try to solve it now)

Its modular and adjustable nature allows it to be fully removed so you can longboarding / skateboarding without it.

*The connector should always be on the truck

Facebook: facebook.com/funingco

Twitter: twitter.com/funingco

YouTube: youtube.com/channel/UCWGOdWFVOO7bJs_MlRAzwQQ

Instagram: instagram.com/funingco

It's Time To Upgrade Your Board

  • Plug and play

Convert your current board with a simple installation. Keeping your own trucks while your board can not only serve as the best form of personal transportation, but also longboarding / Skateboarding after unloading the kit.

  • Replace your rear truck with the power wheel set

Replace the original truck with the power wheel set of FUNING-BOARD, and it will become a traditional four-wheel electric skateboard which can replace batteries.

 

DIY Your Own Custom Board

FUNING BOARD consists of remote control, power wheel & suspension parts, battery control unit and connector.

The connector only weighs 100g so it can be placed on board all the time.

Power wheel & suspension parts and battery control unit are connected by buckles which is very convenient for disassembly and assembly.

The power battery is replaceable, so that you can purchase more batteries if you need.

 

We want you to feel awesome, so we're not using single motor powertrain.

Motor: 2 x 800 W

 

High quality 18x LG lithium cells with a built-in Battery Management System(BMS)

Cruising range: 12miles

 

Suspension self-adaptive design

The special designed suspension device is applicable for different decks and adapted to different road environment.

Three speed modes

Easy (max speed: 4mph), Normal (max speed: 13mph), Hard (max speed: 19mph)

 

In factory

 

 

Risks and challenges

As a team of engineers, we’ve worked really hard to make sure all the details from product to manufacturing are precisely correct and yield an amazing product.

As a hardware project we are aware that there will be challenges of manufacturing, certification, worldwide shipping and more. We promise to meet all these challenges diligently with a lot of passion. 
We have provided a conservative estimate for our shipping dates, and commit to keeping you informed of our progress both during and following our campaign. We are working all the hours we can to ensure your product arrives on time and surpasses your expectations!

 

Legal & Disclaimer

Laws and regulations pertaining electric longboards or electric skateboards vary by country, state, county, and municipality. You are responsible in making sure that it is legal to ride in your area, so please make sure you investigate your local regulations.  

Skateboarding, and especially on electric powered boards, is an inherently dangerous sport and safety equipment should be used at all times, especially a helmet. Don’t be too cool for safety equipment and risk your life. Even the pros use a helmet and pads. Always watch out for cars while riding on surface roads open to traffic and follow all local rules. Always skate within your abilities and use common sense while riding.  

FUNING Engineering accepts no liability should you injure yourself using any products sold under our brand names. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • You can share with your friends! We'll follow up with a give away, just pay attention to our post in Facebook interactions, Instagram contest.
  • Thanks for your support!!

story:
Cyclic is a new concept of urban carbon fiber bicycle, original, unique and adapted to your way of life. We are a team passionated about bikes and new ideas and, after many hours of engineering and design, we have managed to create the lightest urban bicycle on the market that, you can also customize exactly to your size and configure it with the components and colors that best suit your style. And what is better, all for a price within your reach.

 

 

Surely, you will have heard about carbon fiber many times, but always linked to very technological sectors such as aeronautics or Formula 1 and also to luxury products that, unfortunately, sometime we can not afford. The project's promoter team has been working with this type of materials for almost 20 years and we have designed and calculated hundreds of different parts, but never something as innovative as this bike.

 

 

In Cyclic, we wanted to bet on taking carbon fiber to the cities and, that is why, we have devised a design and manufacturing system that allows us to make very light frames, of very high performance at a tremendously competitive price. For a similar cost, or even less than a traditional metal components bicycle, we offer you a much lighter, more comfortable and manageable alternative.

 

 

In front of the more than 15 kilos that a conventional ride bike can weight, you can have your Cyclic for just around 8 kilos. Incredible isn’t it? That saving in weight will allow you to make less effort, especially when starting and climbing, being able to comfortably go up or down stairs or move more agilely. You can ride your bike easily and almost effortlessly when you get on the subway, the tram or just when you store it at home. The ultimate urban bike. Are you ready to be Cyclic?

 

 

HOW IS YOUR CYCLIC?

After many designs, tests, calculations and prototypes, we came up with a solution able to manufacture carbon fiber frames, very light and resistant, that were made in a simple way and that hardly consumed time or resources. Our exclusive patented manufacturing system allows us to produce locally without resorting to process outsourcing to factories in Asia.

 

 

The result is a very light frame that combines technologically very advanced materials, such as high-strength polymers reinforced with fiber, which give it unique characteristics in terms of strength and energy absorption capacity. All this, together with the carbon fork. You can also customize it in different colors. Are you ready to choose yours?

 

 

CUSTOM SIZE

Thanks to the design of the assembly, we can create a bike completely adapted to you.  A fundamental aspect when you are riding a bike,either by the city, by the mountain or on the road, is to have an appropiate, comfortable and adapted position to your needs and likes. A forced position or a bicycle of a size that does not fit to your figure can cause us important muscle and joint lesion and a bad use of your own effort.

All bicycles on the market are manufactured based on a size scale (S, M, L, ...) calculated based only on the user's height and do not always adapt 100% to our characteristics.

Cyclic's modular manufacturing system allows us to make custom frames in record time, exactly adapted to the user's size by only indicating three simple measures: total height, leg length and arm length. Thanks to physiotherapy studies, we can adapt the frame perfectly to your needs and, also, to your pedaling likes.

 

DESIGN YOUR OWN CYCLIC

Now that you know our exclusive frame ¿can you imagine being able to customize the rest of the bike components? In Cyclic we make it possible, we offer you the possibility to choose between different types of accessories and a multitude of colors. 

We want your bike to be a unique object!

 

 

 

Take this opportunity! We offer you the possibility to choose between one of our models. These are the color combinations we have chosen for you.

 

 

EXTRAS

In addition to everything we have told you, our bikes incorporate several accessories and components that make it the ultimate urban bicycle.

REAR LED LIGHT

All models have LED taillight integrated into the frame itself. It is charged by USB connection, it is easily removable to prevent theft, it has 50 hours of autonomy, waterproof and several modes of operation, among those that stand out the braking sensor that increases the intensity of the lighting when it detects a deceleration.

TANNUS TIRES

If you are tired of having to change wheels due to inconvenient punctures or if you simply want to forget forever of having to inflate the wheels of your bike, we offer you the option of incorporating Tannus tires. There are even lighter than conventional camera and cover solutions and you can choose from a wide variety of colors. Forget about problems and maintenance for more than 6,000 kilometers and ride without worries with a total grip, both dry and wet, thanks to its innovative Aither® material

 

 

BIKONE BOTTOM BRACKET

In collaboration with the Spanish company BIKONE BEARINGS we incorporate in all our frames its innovative technology in the bottom brackets that are exclusively manufactured for Cyclic, that ensure the best behavior, without noise or cracking and with surprising lightness and durability.

 

3 SPEED INTERNAL HUB

If the slopes are not your thing and you want to ride comfortably, we offer you the possibility of incorporating a three-speed internal hub integrated in the rear axle. You will keep all the urban aesthetics of your Cyclic and there will be no ramp that resists you.

 

 

CYCLIC IS TECHNOLOGY

In competitive cycling, carbon fiber began to be introduced in the frames, and in other components such as forks and handlebars. But what about urban bicycles? Why in this sector almost all the frames and components are still made of steel or, at most, aluminum? The answer, as usual, is found on the price. Making a carbon fiber frame with traditional methods is very expensive, for the materials and also for the design and production process. While making a traditional one in steel, it is a much simpler and cheaper work. Under this scene, it is easy to understand why carbon has not been introduced into the urban world.

 With carbon fiber we can obtain the same, or even better, mechanical characteristics than in a piece made of steel, but with a weight five or six times less. That is, maximum strength and rigidity, but very lightly.

 

For the realization of the prototypes and of the definitive designs, we have invested many hours of calculation and development, using the most advanced simulation techniques and following the rules that regulate the main cases of load in use of a bicycle.

 

CYCLIC IS ENVIRONMENT

 

At Cyclic, we are committed with the environment and we did not want to keep our bike as a simple element of sustainable urban mobility. Thanks to the exclusive manufacturing system, we managed to boost local production and achieve a production process close to zero CO2 emissions. The carbon footprint of a Cyclic frame is practically zero since, on one hand, we eliminate the emissions associated with import and transoceanic transport and, on the other, energy consumption and the generation of waste associated with the production process is almost residual in comparison with traditional methods.

 

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR WITH THIS CAMPAIGN?

It is very simple, on one hand, we want to make ourselves known and give the opportunity to our first followers to have a totally innovative and customized urban bicycle for an absolutely unbeatable price. On the other, we need your help to start the project at an industrial level due to we need financing to acquire the molds that allow us to manufacture high-quality customized frames, with little effort.

 

FUNDING

Our exclusive and patented modular manufacturing system allows us to produce fully customized frames in size, extremely light and resistant, in an agile and sustainable way, not only to stress, but also to the corrosion produced by water and moisture by not carrying metallic components.

The current prototypes have been manufactured using 3D printing techniques and additive manufacturing and, although the result has been amazing, its high cost prevents the final production process through such techniques.

In order for the joining parts of the tubes that make up the complete frame to have the necessary quality and strength, we need to manufacture them by means of an injection process of a carbon fiber composite material specially designed for us. That’s why, we need a series of molds that are the primary object of our investment.

 

THE TEAM

 

We are a dynamic and flexible team with diverse and complementary capabilities, but with one thing in common: the illusion for this project. We don't want to be just another company that sells bicycles, we want to create a community, see the streets full of bikes and think that we are having an impact on the world around us.

Daniel Rodríguez
Former professional athlete with more than 15 years of career. Expert in sports marketing and distribution.

Rosa González
Social educator with great skills and abilities for the development of corporate social responsibility activities and actions of environmental improvements and urban sustainability

Sergio Serrano
Industrial engineer with more than 20 years of experience working with advanced materials. Passionate about bicycles and innovative projects.
